text: 750 ml bottle into tulip glass, bottled on 9/5/2016. Pours slightly hazy medium golden yellow color with a 1-2 finger dense white head with good retention, that reduces to a thin cap that lingers. Nice spotty soapy lacing clings on the glass, with a moderate amount of streaming carbonation retaining the cap. Aromas of big tart lemon, lime, apricot, peach, mango, pineapple, melon, pear, green apple, white wine, oak, hay, straw, leather, grass, pepper, wet musty funk, wheat, cracker, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of fruity/funky yeast, apricots, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt notes; with good strength. Taste of big tart lemon, lime, apricot, peach, mango, pineapple, melon, pear, green apple, white wine, oak, hay, straw, leather, grass, pepper, wet musty funk, wheat, cracker, light vinegar, and yeast/oak earthiness. Light fruity/lactic tartness and yeast/oak spiciness on the finish. Lingering notes of tart lemon, lime, apricot, peach, mango, pineapple, melon, pear, green apple, white wine, oak, hay, straw, leather, grass, pepper, wet musty funk, wheat, cracker, and yeast/oak earthiness on the finish for a good bit. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky yeast, apricots, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; with an amazing malt/tartness balance, and zero puckering/astringent flavors after the finish. Light dryness from tart/spiciness, lightly increasing through the glass. Medium-plus carbonation and medium body; with a very smooth, moderately crisp, creamy/grainy, and fairly acidic/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is awesome. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 5%. Overall this is an insane fruit lambic! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/funky yeast, apricots, oak barrel, and moderate pale malt flavors; very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the mellow acidity/tartness. Plenty of funky yeast complexity; with perfectly balanced fruit, oak, and malt notes. A highly amazing offering.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2017 2015 Bottle thanks to Niels. Aroma is apricot, nice funk, citrus, lactic acid, stone fruit. Hazy golden with white head. Taste is moderate sour and very dry, more stone fruit. Light body, dry/oily feel and stone fruit apricot finish.

On tap @ArrogantSourFestival.
Color pompelmo rosa, opalescente, schiuma bianca di persistenza molto buona.
Aroma di albicocca, mela acidula, barrique, leggero cuoio e cantina.
Al palato mela acidula, albicocca, intermezzo con pera e mela acida, finale legnoso con una nota di cantina e di albicocca.
Poco carbonata, texture oleosa, corpo medio, medio-pieno.
Al club de tast de lOlut...Aquests de Cantillon són uns mestres de les làmbiques... sorpresa: albercoc en lloc de les fruites habituals.
Shared bottle at Olut Sabadell. Light orange, lemon juice coloured. Champagne and apricot aromas. Acid lightly astringent, very well balanced.

Bottle Fou Foune at Cantillon. Hazy orange with a good white head. Zesty lemon peel. Aroma of funk, horse, barley, abricot. Flavour is moderate sour with barley, Abricot finish. Tart. Acidic. Slight bitterness from abricot and lemon(?) peel and stone. Really good.

04/2017 @home - 75cl bottle from the brewery.
Cloudy orange, small white lacing. Nose is sour, fruity, tad sweet, some wood. Taste is apricot, sweet sour, less typical Cantillon than most of their beers I tasted.

2015 bottle, 0.75l, courtesy of Bongtribe, shared with Saska & Tomi. Hazy golden orange color with thin creamy off-white head and average sparkling appearance. Aroma is yeast, musty, fruity, grainy and woody. Taste starts with refreshing fruity sourness, following is grainy and mild funky, mouthfeel is crisp, while finish is tart. Medium body, thin but creamy texture and lively carbonation in palate.Just superb...

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2017 From tap; hazy pale golden with small white head; aroma is citric, funky; taste is very citric, dry funky, soft sourness, apricot comes through nicely after it warmed up; texture is juicy with high carbonation

750ml bottle. Hazy golden yellow with a foamy white head. Flavors are citrus, peach and apricot flesh/skin with sweet, mineral and funky notes. Light to medium body, soft to moderate carbonation, smooth texture.

Pours hazy ripe yellow with 1cm carbonation. Really develops over time, aromas of peach, apricot and other stonefruits. Mouthfeel is velvety, finish is long and sweet. This is the 2016 FF, and I also had the 2015, which was way more sour, less fruity, but developed incredibly over the course of an hour.
Very distinct, yet subtle aroma and taste of abricot. Sour, tart and challenging.

2014 Vintage.
Bright cloudy yellow, one finger head
Aroma is sweet fruits, apricot, little hay
Taste is lots of apricot, lightly sour, mellow, sweet, well carbonated,

2016 Vintage
Has the same ratings in my book.
Sample at Ölrepubliken during GBG Beer Week 2017. Hazy golden with white head. Sour fruity with stone fruit and barnyard. Dry with medium acidity and medium carbonation.

Bottle, 750 ml at the brewery, shared with Miro. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Fruity, apricot, some light sweetness, nice sourness, smooth, some barnyard notes, funk. Very balanced and smooth. Medium bodied.
750ml bottled 2016-08-29. Pour dark yelloish no foam. Aroma is of bad apple, probably not good. Taste is acid of coarse. High carbonation. Long tart finish.
2014 bottle; Hairy fresh apricots with soft velvety hay Brett funk, tangy apricot tannins, a bit spicy, medium sour, mostly lactic and apricots, light grain

2014 bottle, 2.5 years old. Incredible aroma, cant imagine a more perfect nose on a sour. Appearance is brilliantly clear and brass-yellow of color. Taste and palate are great, but very very tart at 2.5 years old. Apricot flavor seems subdued over time though. Fantastic beer, wish i had it younger though!
0.75l fles om 2017 mee in te luiden met lion. Goede balans in de zure smaken mooi afgerond.pure appelsap met een fris fruitzuur. heerlijk
Shared bottle. great fruity taste, great funky sour balance that make a smile in your face.

Botella @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo 23/12/2016. Bottled:2016
Color amarillo, sabor fruta, agrio, cuerpo medio, agradable, rica.

75cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 07-12-2016.
Bottled: 29 august 2016.
In short: tasty smooth lambic.
Pours quite hazy deep gold with frothy white head. Short head retention, good lacing.Tart nose, some apricot, grapy, some horseblanket. Medium body, high carbonation, little crispy texture. Taste is little tart at the beggining, some apricot, little brett character, then turns quite smooth and creamy palated. Very well balanced and enjoyable. Lovely one.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

On tap at Moeder Lambic. 2016 edition. It poured a hazy golden colour with a minimal white head. Slightly sour aroma but not massive. Farmhouse, acidic notes. Apricot perhaps. Flavour is bitter and acidic, but again its a mellow acidic. Lots of citrus but also hay, grass and some tropical fruits. I normally dont like sours but this is a good beer. Medium long, lingering aftertaste.

On tap @ LambicZoon Milano. Giallo ambrato, velato, schiuma bianca grossolana poco persistente. Aroma intenso, pungente, fruttato, citrico, classico delle fermentazioni spontanee, luppolo vecchio, polvere, pelle del salame. quando il naso si assuefà, arrivano i profumi secondari di albicocca essicata e marmellata. Gusto estremamente acido. Fruttato citrico, quasi nessuna attenuazione da parte delle albicocche. Poco corposa, poco carbonata, estremamente spigolosa, piena, basso il calore alcolico. Equilibrata, decisamente armonica.
UPDATED: NOV 3, 2016 Hazy orange. Sweet apricot aroma. Plain palette. Strong apricot. Dusty lambic boogie.

Hazy orange beer with nice head on top going to the sides of the glass. Aroma has lots of apricot and other sweet fruit notes, then some sourness and yeast. Taste has sweetness and apricot, then moderate sourness in ending. Medium body and medium carbonation. A bit juicy feel because of the apricot.  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

On tap, Moeder Fontainas. Hazy orange colour with big white head. I guess quite young this one, usual superb funky Cantillon base but have to say beyond a sweeter hint than is perhaps normal I wouldnt have said apricot especially.

Bottle. Pours light orange, bit hazy with no head. Aroma is mix of peach and barnyard plus just a bit of barnyard. In taste medium to low sour, peachy. Medium body, fizzy carbonation, peachy, dry and medium sour finish. After few years peach was still quite strong, the beer very fruity and tasty. Best peach lambic/beer I had.
My favorite Cantillon bottle. I am a sucker for peach and this one does it for me.

Finally got a hold of this after failing in two consecutive Snallygasters. Apricot and orange peel. Some grapefruit. Hazy orange pour with decent head. Tangy finish. Very good but underwhelming considering hype. Tap at Sovereign.

Un Lambic impressionnant tant par sa robe...abricot... que par son nez qui allie des notes de lambic à celles de labricot frais mais également confituré. La bouche est tendue, acidulée, puissante, longue et complexe. Une bouteille impressionnante. Un régal de fin de soirée.
Many bottles and finally draft! My favorite Cantillon. Light body, perfectly balanced with a nice acidity and fruit. Never too sweet. Belgian yeast. Dry fruity aftertaste. Heaven

Bottle at Sovereign. Hazy yellow with small white head. Aroma is fantastic funky barnyard, yeast, vinegar, fruit. Taste is very tart and acidic fruit and yeast. Fantastic lambic, with my favorite funky aroma to date.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 Tap an bottle vintages 2006 & 2016 at Erzbierschof Zurich on Zwanze 2016. Lots of apricot, the bottles more so than the tap, but the latter one opened a bit more over time. Light sourness and tartness, a bit sweet and rather fruity. Iron, too. Medium body, low soft carbonation. Long apricot palate. Turns drier and lighter with age, with an increased complexity but also a bit more citric sourness. Absolutely stellar.

Bottle pour at Belgian Beer Weekend Tokyo. Pours a hazy, deep maize gold with 2 fingers of foam that lingers. Funky farmhouse notes with an explosion of apricot. Could smell the apricot even when the glass was on the table. Lots of cobwebs, funk and musty peaches. Gooseberry and lemon on the palate with more apricot. Some bitterness from the apricot skins I assume, but it works well and almost makes it seem like a hoppy sour dry-hopped with fresh apricot. Fantastic.

750 mL bottle.. Bottle dated August 19, 2011. Originally reviewed 10/28/2011.

Hazy, murky orange body with an ample, pillowy head. Continuous froth as I drink it. Couldnt look better for a lambic. It even looks the color of an apricot.

Beautiful, subtle apricot aroma. Slight acidity in the aroma. Not much funk, which is disappointing, but its probably what allows the apricot aroma to be so perfect.

Slight apricot flavor immediately overtaken by lambic acidity. A bit of barnyard funk and some hay and wheat flavors. The finish is slightly bitter, but it gives way to a nice apricot flavor in the finish. Its as if the apricot flavor is continuously there, but the lambic comes through and overwhelms it at certain points.

The lightest lambic I have had. Amazingly flavorful for so little body. It really allows the apricot to shine. Perfect carbonation, of course.

Cantillon really does a terrific job with fruit lambics. Theyre more acidic than funky, which allows the fruit to shine. In this case, the fruit flavor is perfect and manages to showcase without being a fruit bomb.
05-05-16 // sample at Cantillon Quintessence 2015. Paired with ashy goat cheese. Fruity sweet sour. Amazing apricot notes.

Bottle share, thank you to whomever brought this, probably Jeremy... wonderful beer. Pours a gentle orange color with a modest sandy head. Aromatic with fresh ripe apricots, very fruity and rich. Some funk. The taste is fruity sweet with plenty of the apricot and some bugs. Great balance of fruit to funk. One of the best beers of the night and as it turns out my highest rated lambic to date.

2016 Boise stone fruit tasting on 8/27. 750ml bottle pours out a cloudy pale golden, small airy head. Big blast of apricots, Belgian yeast notes, and some other funk. Taste continues with more of the same

A 750ml bottle at the brewery. I believe it was bottled in August 2015. Poured into a Cantillon tasting glass. It poured a hazy golden orange colour with a two finger white head with pretty good retention and left sparse lacing. Aromas are funky, sour, apricot, stone fruit and citrusy lemon. Taste is sour, tart, apricot, mango, orange, barnyard, hay with a hint of vinegar. Crisp, light bodied with moderate spritzy carbonation. Overall, this was just wow. Really really good. Easily a must buy in my book and Im definitely on the lookout for it.
Bright by somewhat hazy golden orange color with off-white lacing. Juicy aroma of apricots, yogurt, and oak. Quite tart in taste. Light body, crisp, and lively. Long finish of tart apricots.

Pours a hazy orange with some white foam around the edges of the glass. Noses like Haribo peaches and you pretty much cant beat that. I love that smell and it never fails. The fresher the bottle the more intense of course. Taste is fruity initially and along the lines of the nose. But there is a layer of mineral stone fruits and bretty, farmy, maybe even cheesy flavour that is all up in the mix as well. I think apricots and peach works very well in sour, but of all the beers with those fruits incorporated, Fou Foune reigns supreme. Fou Foune is King and I dont think you can beat it.
2015 bottle cloudy orange color no head. Medium sourness. Huge juicy apricot flavor and nose. Barnyard nose.

750ml bottle from Legacy. Vintage August 25, 2015. Tasting at Brians. Pours a hazy straw with a weak white head. Medium carbonation. Aroma is sour, fruity with apricots anf stone fruit notes. Same notes taste. Interesting.

Bottle shared at the CBC big bottle share. 7/7/2016. Thanks. A hazed yellow straw coloured pour with a lasting. Thin head. Sticky. Aroma is sour apricot, funky, horsey, citrus sour lemon. Flavour is composed of sour, apricot, mango, really sour puckering acid, citrus, citrus acid. Palate is sour, citrus, spritzy carbonation, tang, apricot. Really enjoyable.

At the epic peach/apricot sour tasting. Aroma is apricot, funk, tart, sour, lambic perfect. Appearance is hazy, dark golden, off white head. Taste is apricot, funk, tart, sour, wonderful sweet and tart, perfectly balanced. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, prefect apricot aftertaste. Overall, lives up to the hype. Wow.

Pours hazy light golden with a thin line of white head. .Aroma; apricot, acidic, barnyard, hay, lemon and a touch of vinegar. Taste; Apricot, barnyard, hay, lemon, minerals and some vinegar. Very tasteful.

Bottle at Himmeriget, vintage 2014. Hazy light golden with a big creamy head. Aroma medium acidic with fruity apricot notes, brett, wood. Flavor medium+ acidic, apricot fruity, wood, hay, ending light dry. Medium body. Great experience, thx Carsten..

Bottle from Dranken Geers. Sweet and sour stone fruit, pickle juice, watermelon, and faint, sweet banana aroma. Cloudy but effervescent gold under a lasting, white blanket. Sour orange and apricot and dry, with no bitterness, but crisp and very thirst quenching. Light body, medium high carbonation, mouth puckering.
Big thanks to Tony. Nice bright yellow color. Crazy funk nose. So tart and funky in the flavor. Perfect balance. Very very good beer.
Bottle Pours hazy yellow with big fluffy white head.Aroma:sour, sulphur, berries, some sweetness, apricot, curds- really nice . Taste: heavy sour, malty, weak wheat, sulphur, woody, Nice one
Hazy yellow liquid with white head. Aroma of lactose, cider vinegar, apricot. Taste is woody, earthy, light sweet, light bitter, heavy sour. Light body, creamy feel, average carbonation, long finish,

750 ml. bottle. Bottle shared by some guy at a local brewery. Pours a bright golden orange with a medium head. Aroma of apricot, lemon peel and wheat notes. Some acidic lambic, barrel, wet wool, and barnyard. Flavor is sour, with wood and earthy notes, strong apricot. Slick bodied, funky finish. Very lively carb. This is killer.

Bottle, vintage 2015. Pours hazy light golden, with a big creamy head. Aroma is acidic, with nice fruity notes of apricots and bretty wood, as well as hay, fruit peel, lemon and farmhouse notes. Medium body, with soft carbonation. Flavour is tart musty fruity notes, with peaches and lemon peel, as well bretty notes of wood, hay and farmhouse notes. Balanced, tart fruity finish.
750ml bottle at Cantillon brewery. Apricot nose. Soft fruity tartness. Perfectly balanced, sweet lingering finish. This beer is quite something else.

Bottle from Himmelriget. Hazy yellow with low white head. Quite high carbonation. Aroma of sourness, apricot and wheat malt. Taste is dry apricot, wheat, Sour with Sour aftertaste. Only improvement would be even more apricot or a supplement of passionfruit!
Bottle. 2015 Vintage. Apricot and a light tart, crisp fruitiness. Slight funk. Great beer!

Bottle. August 2015 vintage. So well put together. Apricot is a part of the beer rather than something added. Medium to high sour and tart. Moderate funk, mustiness. Semi dry. Nothing overpowers. Intricate. Excellent.

750ml bottle pours out a hazy golden straw color topped with a small head. nose is amazing apricot lots of the classic cantillon funk barrel notes. Taste is more of the amazing funky barnyard lemon apricot notes. I love this one.

Birra fresca, estiva piacevole. Laroma ricorda quello della frutta estiva appesa raccolta: pesche, albicocche non ancora mature, limone. Nel finire una nota di cuoio. Equilibrio magico tra acidità e dolcezza. Corpo medio e buona secchezza.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
Bottle shared by Bruce. Pours yellow with funk aroma. Taste is the perfect tartness with straw an hay with some fruit to finish.

Pours glowing golden hazy orange with thick white head. Smell is sour yeasty, barnyard funk. hay and hints of apricot. Taste is sour cherry, dry grape, oak, yeast and a hint of apricot. Tart dry finish. Light body heavy carb.

From a note - on tap at Mr Dunderbaks in Tampa during Hunahpu weekend: gold pour with huge fluffy white head that took for ever to dissipate. aroma of woody, sour, funk, barnyard, peach. tastes light easy funk, lemon tart, hay, vinegar, apple, peach, wheat, wood, acidic. even, jammy, dry.
Bottle @ Himmeriget. hazy yellow colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of apricot, sourness, acidic, vinegar and barnyard.
Bottle @ himmeriget copenhagen. Pours a hazy golden colour beer with a small head. Bretty, yeasty with apricots and lemongrass. Dry bretty finish

750ml bottle (2014) thanks to Felix on HBT. Poured a hazy straw/orange color with a fast fading fizzy white head of foam. Aroma of funk, vinegar, tart apricots, and bready malts. Taste is much the same. Lots of tart semi sweet apricots, white vinegar, funk, some grassiness, fruit skins, and bready malts. Very dry and lots of sharp fizzy carbonation. Great stuff!

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2016 Bottle. 2015 vintage. Orange color, white head. Aroma is funky, leather, barnyard, grapes and apricot. Taste is medium sour, very dry, moderate tart. Flavor of baryard, earthy, apricot, gooseberry. Nicely balansed and complex. Great.

A huge thanks to Alex (Beermack) for sending me this to celebrate my daughter being born! This is a phenomenal and complex beer -- the base lambic is (obviously) well made, but the apricot addition makes it even better. The drying, puckering sensation from the fruit pairs really well with the sour, tart lambic, and both are mellowed out by each other. World class stuff.

Un grand merci à Marc-André Blain pour le partage en cette journée de DrinkItNow! Une robe orangée qui trahit un jus dabricot frais, serré et parfumé. Une magnifique mousse blanche se forme à la surface de ce liquide impeccable alors que des émanations fruitées, estivales et ensoleillées emplissent la pièce de mon petit appartement mal éclairé du Boulevard Saint-Joseph. Je ferme les yeux et je revis ces nombreux après-midi passés à la Brasserie, où jai u le privilège de côtoyer ces levures dans leur alma mater. Dès la première gorgée, des fines bulles explosent dans me bouche apportant une fraîcheur douce et minérale. Puis vient labricot. Un assaut fruité dont je suis lheureuse victime. Lattaque est sans fin. Le funk Cantillon, le noyau de fruit, leffervescence, la minéralité... Cest lextase!

Ein Lambic wie es sein sollte. Etwas ungewöhnlich angelegt im Bereich von Aprikosen und Orangen, aber dennoch klassisch in Fruchtigkeit und Säure. Sehr einfach zu trinken, leicht im Essigbereich angesiedelt und wunderbar süffig. Absolut empfehlenswert.

0,75 bottle at Cantillon Brewery. Hazy pale yellow colour. Nice white head. Aroma is clear, juicy, amazing apricot. Acid, barnyard, apricot at the beginning. Wine and apricots. Hints of wood. Powerful apricots in the end. Hints of oakiness with the apricots again in aftertaste. Very well balanced, light bodied, refreshing enjoyment.

Bottle form Rudat in Dortmund. The Lambic has got a hazy light amber -strawy colour with a medium body. Mild to medium carbonation. Aroma of acid, sourness and kernels. Taste of mild vinegar, unripe fruits, acid, mild sourness, unripe apricots, apricot seeds and unripe nuts. Sour finish. Tasty and interesting one.

Bottle at the brewery. 2015. Hazy, dark yellow. Ring of dense, white head. Nose has apricot jam. Earthy, apricot stone. Malt sugars (or is it that because today is a brew day?). Beautifully fruity, with that tart undertone. Taste is lightly tart. Soft, fruity sweetness. Lovely, massaging mouthfeel. Finishes light tart and dry. Lovely.

2016 Vintage.

AROMA: Marmalade, flowers, wet hay, summers end. Wood, honey, apricot.

APPEARANCE: Golden, light, medium head, lively.

TASTE: Excellent, mild funk, preserved dried apricots, spritzy, puckering, sourish.

PALATE: Very dry and light bodied. 

OVERALL: I can see why its all the rage. Not my personal favourite but one I will go for whenever I next he the chance. Best drunk at the brewery top ensure freshness.

Bottle at Pozarevac tasting redux. Special thanks to Johnny in Rome for providing and Alberto for carrying it over. Lovely barnyard sweet funk. Sweet funk, a little bit of waxy chapstick. Funky cheese. So balanced. A really special treat, funky perfection.
Bomber shared at tasting. Cloudy golden pour. Super fruity aroma. Taste is more acidic and sour. Amazing beer, really love this one!
This apricot lambic is just fantastic. The apricot character is not bold or strong, however its very soft and delicated. Sourness is strong but not too strong, very satisfying.

75cl Bottle
 pours a golden yellow with white fluffy head
 Aroma is sour fruit citric tones
 Taste is dry citric fruit sour but not as sour as some Lambics
 another great beer from Cantillon

Bottle from 2013. Cloudy golden body with white head. Aroma is fantastic, apricots with nice balanced sourness and hints of malts. Taste is also fruity apricots with malts and some barnyard and sourness. Aftertaste is fruity sour with hints of bitterness. Perfect. This would be the perfect summer beer.

2015 75cl bottle all to myself on Christmas Day. Pours murky orange with fast receding head. Aroma is musty apricot with prickly wild yeast. Taste is sadly lacking in apricots; they are there, soft and mushy, but the bristly, thorny lambic character takes president with an acidic vinegary finish. I get the sense my eagerness got the better of me and this fresh bottle shouldve been laid for a while to allow those flavours to develop.
Bottle @ Cantillon 15/5-15. [Vintage 2014]. Very fruity with a lot of apricots, also acidic. Dry, fruity and acidic finish.
UPDATED: MAY 6, 2016 A perfect beer. Brilliant yellow/orange color and mild carbonation. When its fresh, the fruit is intense, but as the fruit fades, the sourness takes over.

UPDATED: JAN 27, 2017 Jan 27 sampled at the brewery, just delicious. Tons of apricots, semi-dry, lambic funk, minerals and hey. Very refreshing.

Tried again on Nov 18, 2016, same batch. Much better than the first time, tons of apricots in both aroma and taste, more sweet and round.
Dec 13, 2015Either this beer is a bit hyped, or the 2015 is weaker than the rest. I expected more apricot in the nose, as well as the taste. It is a well made lambic, no doubt about it, but not much fruit going on.
Een zeer zure smaak, te zuur voor mij. Dus niet lekker voor mij, ook weinig schuimkraag.

2014 bottle. Pours a cloudy orange with a mostly lasting small bubbly off white head. Aroma of white grapes, apricots, pine, green apple, hay, natural yoghurt. Taste is of apricot, tart, white grapes, some spice. Long tart, citrusy finish. Full carbonation, light oily to watery mouthfeel. Lovely.

UPDATED: NOV 18, 2016 Quintessence 2016. Hazy pale golden, yellow with thin white head. Apricot, elderflower, light moldiness, dankness, sweaty, floweriness, blossom, fruit stones. Light sour, rich minerallike. Medium body, very soft feeling. Cloudy yellow/orange with white head. Grapestone and apricot, grapes, hay. Dense aroma. Sour and bitter above medium. Nice.

Bottle 0.75l at Ultimate tasting in Pozarevac Serbia.24.10.2015.Special thanks to ippopotamo36 bravo for this bottle.Taste with Cika Boban, Vlada ciao, Alberto bro and Matt bro.Pour it hazy yellow color with small white head.Aroma of cheese some fruits.Taste fruity, apricots really present, smooth and juicy, salty finish.Perfect balanced.
I should give it a five. Its amazing, just so classily tart, yet clean and dry and killer. Light fruit coming through. I love how the tart lingers, not too acidic. Ya

Draft:
Hazy golden yellow with a creamy white head.
Subtle, but fresh, apricot aroma.....musty.....
Flavour is a nice, tart apricot.
Very delicate and soft..
Delicious.
Bottle. Very interesting aroma with hints of something unexpected. Taste pleasantly complex.
backlog. Cloudy orange colour, small head. Nice funky brett notes in the aroma, green apples, peach. Taste is acidic, finish is long sour. Fresh.
75cl bottle, tasting @ Chez Alain, Rennes. Hazy yellowish. Tart and funk, fruity, very sour finish. Complex and fruity, while apricot is not obvious.
UPDATED: JUL 8, 2016 A: Light brown/orange, lacing along the edge. N: apricot, funk T: Apricot. O: very nice fresh! Nice tartness!

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 2015 version from tap at Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Aroma of fruits, sour citrus, apricot, wood, some Brett funk. Flavour is medium to heavy sour with a very dry finish. Body is medium. Very refreshing and nicely sour, rather fruity.

Bottle at the Pozarevac tasting in Serbia 10242015. Purchased at Johnny Off L. in Rome-Italy. Pours cloudy light orange color, little lacing. Nose: cheesy, some summer fruit (not that much of apricots), cellar, sour fruit as well. Mouth: frizzy, sour fruitiness, sour marmalade, dry finish.
Bottle at Cantillon. Pours highly hazy with a white head. Aroma of apricots, tangerine, wood, tartness. Taste is apricots, tart, wood, dry, funk, brett, fruity. High carbonation. Extremely good!!!

Cloudy with a light white head. Apricots very present in the aroma. Intensely sour

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle at a tasting. Mostly bretty aroma. Very nicely balanced in taste. Moderate sourness, rounded, pleasant, only light complementary peach showing mostly in late taste. Very good.

750 ml bottled 24 August 2015, shared by Mmahut at Bratislava Tasting, thanks!
Amber, hazy body, with a medium, frothy, white head.
Aroma of barnyard, young cheese, sweet and sour apples, apricot, peach, some vinegar.
Tastes of barnyard, sweet and sour apples, pears, apricot, peach, berries, juice, some vinegar.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with an average carbonation.
Finishes very fruity, juicy, wooden, medium sour, with some more apples and pears.

Very tasty. Fruitier than other cantillons Ive had, pretty juicy, with a well balanced sourness and just subtle barrel notes. The finish is just wonderful, with very long-lasting juicy notes. Propably my favourite Cantillon so far.

Bottle. Hazy golden colour, small white head. Aroma is typical lambic, sour, barnyard, bacterial, fruity, peach and apricots, bit winy, vinegary. Taste is sour, fruity, peach. Cork. This is a very good beer.

Dark orange foggy body with white head. Smells dominantly appricot, has a sour smell, has some citrus tones, some spices, has a slight pickles smell or fruit vinegar. Tastes very sour, lots of citrus taste, the appricot taste is not very dominant at first but the after taste is like appricot marmelade. Even though I am not a big fan of sour beer, I really enjoyed this combination.

750ml bottle shared by mmahut at Bratislava RB Tasting, big thanks. orange cloudy color, small white head. smells of peach, light sourness, marzipan, almonds, pickles, spices. nice smell. light to medium body, soft pearly carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes sour, wood, fruits, green apples, marzipan, almonds, some peach at the beginning, citrus. finishes with apricot marmelade, sourness some green apples. good stuff, sourness is in check, nice fruit notes, also quite lovely smell. good stuff.
Bottle at Joined Slovak&Austian ratebeer session 10/2015. Pours orange color, white head. Aroma of peach, sourish. Taste is sour, medium sweet, peach, orange, lemon, vinegar.

Been here many times as by my flat. Pours a haze cloudy yellow ish orange. Aroma of some fruit and lemon peel. Very funky and tart with some well balanced earthiness and cheesy hops. Very complex and dry.

Great fresh apricot nose. The beer starts very great smooth. Lots of horse blanket, soft fruity apricots. The sourness is very moderate, wood. Extreme full bodied, soft and intense horse blanket in the aftertaste. The fruit is hidden, but still there. Great stuff!
Orange color with solid foam layer. Apricot and/or peach nose. The taste is sour and apricot fruity with a nicely balanced carbonation. Just nice. Sour and dry aftertaste.

For me one of the best Cantillon"s. 2015 vintage from cask @ moeder L. A lot of apricot in the aroma, mild sour and sour apricot peach vanilla finish. Bottled version at cantillon (first botteling) Apricot is less present, comes more in when served with yeast, finish is apricot jam. Also had a glass from the last botteling, with more ripe apricot, this is going a lot towards Apricot marmelade/jam. All versions were exeptional

UPDATED: OCT 9, 2015 Een vier is misschien ietsje te hoog gerated voor dit bier, Vond hem in het begin wel héél zurig, op het einde werd het beter.

Edit: moet mijn mening echt bijstellen, vandaag een tweede fles van kunnen opendoen. Gewoonweg perfect.

UPDATED: AUG 18, 2016 Aug 2015 - Bottle share at Chrisos as Cantillon Fou Foune, 5%. 2014 vintage. Hazy orange, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is apricots, peach, home-made lemonade. Body is medium to light, foamy, soft carbonation. Taste is tart lemon, elderflower, minerals, dry finish with a light acidity. Apricots not showing up much in the flavour. Very nice. (3.8)
Jul 2016 - Bottle share at Craft Beer Co Islington.  Thanks! Opaque orange, still foamy off-white head.  Aroma is orange and peach.  Taste is peach, yellow plum with a tart finish.  Very good.  (3.9)

Draft at akkurakt.
Hazy yellow, white head.
Aroma of banana, honey, cellar.
Nice candy feel, sweet banana, sour chewing gum, apricot. Like it!

Draft at akkurat
Hazy orange yellow. Heavy sweet, medium sour, light bitter. Apricot, apricot. Wow
On tap at zwanze day. Light yellow with pink haze. Light sour candy aroma, green apple. Medium sour, light bitter. Dry finish, sour finish. Strong berry lemonade palate finish. Good one

Cask @ Moeder Lambic, Fontainas, 2015 vintage, 6% ABV. Pours an opaque orange with a large-bubbled head. Aroma is a strong apricot, peach, light sour, light vanilla. Taste is not really that sour. Apricot is strong, quite a lot of appleskin as well. Sour apricots.

Bottle @ Voldby øl-messe. Pours hazy yellow with a white head, some lacing. Aroma is sourness, barnyard, dusty, rich tart fruity, apricot, wood, leather notes. Flavor is rather sour, tart fruity, unripe peaches, rich apricot, wood, barnyard, dust, leather. Medium body, soft carbonation, tart fruity acidic finish. 290815
cloudy gold. Aroma peaches and mangoes. Tastes tart yeasty briny with perfume hops.

UPDATED: NOV 29, 2015 Bottle at Bullerup puppen. Pours hazy orange with dense white head. Aroma of jucy apricot, barn, tart, sour. Taste is a breef fruity apricot, barn yard, light dusty, overwhelming sour finish. Woaw. Thx alot dolle!

2014 750mL bottle from Moeder Lambic. Poured hazy orange yellow with white head. Aroma face smacking apricot peach jam funk tea. Light carb med bod. Tastes very balanced like biting into dried apricot tart.
75cl bottle thanks to Nisse666. Color is clear orange. Head is persistent and thin to medium. Medium body. Finish is long and spiky. Aroma is apricot, wheat, hoppy, malty, citric, herby, pepper,

From tap v2012. Light hazy golden orange color with small white head. Funky fruity aroma, barnyard notes. Light sweet, acidic, funky fruity taste. Light thin to oily body with soft to flat carbonation.

Cred check: http://i.imgur.com/3mtOngC.png 
Side by side with Halia. Pours a deeper gold color with a white head. Aromas of soured fruit. Taste is sour, some lactic, some acidic. Aggressive Flavors of rotten fruit, some fecal matter. Intense, extreme and unforgiving on any level.

Thanks cards04 for sharing this in Graz, Austria. Light peach coloured body fizzy white head. AroMA of apricot p, vanilla, yeast , funk , banana . Taste is nicely sour acidic, apples , apricot . Awesome sour beer.

Received in trade. Thanks Tim! Pours a hazy orange marmalade colour. Aromas are beautiful ripe apricots. Maybe notes of bubblegum as well. Flavours are very sour. You get some apricot jamminess. But lots of sour vinegar too. Awesome stuff.
Cervesa àcida i refrescant amb aromes de albercoc. En boca es nota una mica més àcida, en aroma es més afruitada. Gran!

Pours gold with a large head.
Nose shows dried apricots along with some funky notes and lemon zest. Awesome.
Tart flavours but with some prominent apricot lending a bit of sweetness. Pretty damn acidic!

Bottle, 75cL. Tasted with @erickok, Tours. Many thanks ! An orange yellow opaque beer ; medium white retention ; good retention. Aroma of apricot, acid note, wood. Medium lasting sour ; dry ; light sweet. Light to medium body ; thin texture ; average carbonation ; dry lasting fruity finish. Overall, a great apricot lambic : intense fruity, woody touch ; very drinkable, elegant.

Bottle at home in garden on hottest day of 2015, 1st July 15. Pours light golden, aroma is light apricot, some funk. Taste is light apricot, some apricot core and skin, wood, funk, barrel, earthy, musty and complex. The base lambic comes through nicely, with sour unripe apricot. Really good sipper, great for hot weather

Bottle at Cantillon in Brussels. Pours light Gold with a White head. Nice delicate apricot aroma backed up by a sour lambic funk. Wonderful apricot flavour with lemony sourness and a bit of woody character. Sour as it was, it acted almost as a rest from the puckering sourness of the other mouth-puckering sours we we were drinking.

Thanks to grownfool for this one! Orange, slightly cloudy, no head. Smells like stone, balsamic vinegar, and apricots. Taste is more fruity than I thought based on the aroma, with apricot, apple, pear and peach coming through. Some stoney flavors mix with balsamic vinegar and dry white wine. Gets a little fruitier as it opens up. Also, not as sour as I was expecting, which works well here. Good stuff.
Pours a hazy straw yellow gold with white head. Funk, apricot, citrus, and tartness on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with apricot notes, tartness, and dry.
Bottle. Pale yellow beer with, small head. Apple, berries, rubber, sourish, citrus aroma. Citrus, rubber, apple and vinous favour. This is magic in a bottle :-)

Bottle at Cantillon. Pour is cloudy, murky orange/yellow with a medium off-white head. Aroma and flavor of sour apricots, slight oak, white grapes, and citrus. Finish is dominated by the sour apricots. Great.
Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon 150515. 2014 bottle. Bretty and really fruity with apricots, acidic, medium body with an oily texture. The finish is long, dry and fruity with apricots.

Draft at Monks Cafe in Phila. Bottom third of the keg. Cloudy peach color with a large frothy foam top. Splashes of lace. Very juicy. Wonderful aroma of powdered sugared fruit candy sours. Pink peaches. Apricots. Nectarines. Yellow plums. Watermelon. This is likely a recent batch because it still holds on to a tremendous amount of its original fruitiness. Just enough dusty dryness for balance. Nearly perfect. Should be wonderful aged but is wonderful now!

2013 750mL bottle shared by AdamJackson, thanks! Pours yellow gold with a white head. Aroma is apricot, white grape, yogurt. Nice, soft mouthfeel. Dry with flavors of apricot, white grape, grass. Oak on the finish.

750 ml bottle, thanks to Adam, thanks for getting me my whale, missed this every single year! 2013 vintage on the cork. Hazy gold color with still lasting head. Aroma is funky apricot, musty lambic yeast and light acid.  
The flavor is tart and sour all together at this point. The yeast is becoming tart and souring in the finish. Carbonation is lively and nicely effervescent. Still a very mild fruit after the swallow but for sure much more tart than fruit juicy. Still a very nice drink.

Poured from bottle 9/13 thanks AdamJackson light cloudy orange very effervescent white head. Aromas of stone fruit and brett with a hint of funk. Taste is clean and crisp similar to the aroma with a lingering tartness. Nice beer.

UPDATED: AUG 26, 2015 Fou foune Cantillon 2008

Bottle shared by KyotoLefty. A lovely cloudy orange with a tart apricot/peach nose. Peach fuzz anyone? Wow thats acidic, sour apricot with a tart sweet fruity finish. Great.  --- foufoune 2015 glass at the brewery was a golden honey color with a corkish nose that is so so. The taste however was a lovely soft apricot, lightly acidic & tart.

Shared at a tasting hosted by Steebo on February 13. Vintage 2011. The pour is a pale yellow with a nice finger of white froth, leaving a couple spots of great lace. The aroma is lovely apricot with some strong brett on the middle. There is a little funk and some sharp tartness on the back end. The flavor is just as great. Lots of fruit, a strong tartness and a little applein there. The mouth feel is great. Lots of bubbly carbonation and a coating texture. The aftertaste is strong on sour, really tart lemon. This is great!

4 oz pour at wild friendship blend event at allagash. Beer was poured cold, maybe 40*F so it was very tart at first sip. Nice subtle apricot tart as the beer warmed. Exceptional color and taste. Overall easily one of the best sour beers Ive tried.

2015/05/02 - Bottle shared at Nuetnigenough in Brussels. Pours a hazy orange honey colour with a fizzy, off white head that slowly reduces. Aroma is very fruity: huge apricot and fuzzy peaches, with hints of barnyard and oak. Taste tart citrus, apricot, peaches, hints of vinegar and mild barnyard. Lots of sour an moderate sweetness. Mouthfeel is light with lots of biting carbonation and a long, tart finish. Crisp, refreshing and delicious.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle to glass at the brewery. Pours a hazy golden light amber color with a nice white head. Aroma is tart apricots, touch of funk. Huge sour in the flavor and finish. Absolutely delicious!

Sample at En Öl- & Whiskymässa, Gothenburg, April, 2015. From a 14 bottle. Hazy peachy with a small white foam. Aroma is incredibly present with apricot, orange juice, lactic and slight funkiness with some wood, tiny hint of white pepper. Taste is above everything VERY fruity, with apricot, slight lactic tone of citrus and vinegar, slight fermented fruit bitterness in an otherwise dry finish. Medium body, low carbo, musty texture. Just a terrific, juicy, musty beer.

Fou Foune 14 vintage

Pours a vibrant, hazy peachy color, with a decent, fizzy head.

Pure apricots. So much fruit, accompanied by wooden stone qualities, fermented apricots and leathery wood. The nose got a glue like, vinegar whiff to it, accentuating the funky tartness, while its focus remains without a doubt on the fruits.

Perfectly carbonated, with a very refreshing light body.

Taste mirrors the nose, regarding the apricots, revealing apricot pulp, vinegar, vaseline, plastic, soap, glue - all funked up, by leather and barnyard. The nose comes incedibly nice together, again, revealing its fruity characteristics. Finishes tart, dry, with a fermented fruit bitterness, still complimenting the apricots, leaving back a tooth pluckering sourness.

Incredibly well pronounced apricots among a supersoft mouthfeel, wrapped up by a thirst quenching, dry sourness. Refreshing in body, juicy, with a sour lemon peel infusion, leaving with a long lasting, acidic tartness.
From a tap at the trapping provisions. The pour is a hazy orange . A great tasting sour with a an medium taste of Apricots.

14 Bottle poured into this Cantillon glass - Its a nice hazy gold, with a one fingered white head that actually retains well. Were starting off on the right foot already. Temperature was perhaps in the middle of where it needed to be - but I slow drank this one until it moved into the ideal threshold, and thats where it really revealed its depth and complexity. Apricot pits to start this one off , mixed with lactic. Typical lambic funk is modest here, but it is here. White pepper, juice, and grass notes round off the nose. The flavor profile was jarring initially, but we got the palate lined up where it needed to be for this one very quickly. Its musty, dank grasses, light lactic, with a well rounded tartness present. White pepper, earthy oak presence, and apricot juice and skins moving forward to lemon zest. The flavor profile is complex and deep, and near perfect at the proper temp. 2014 is a winner in my book and it was the winner of Mels 15 Mini Apricot Tasting.

2014 bottle at home from brewberry Paris hazy amber, no head, moderate carbonation, full bodied, slight Dusty fruit but overwhelming lemony citric sourness. Left overnight in the fridge carbonation subsides and a bit more apricot earthiness comes through but tartness still prevalent. Perhaps needed more age on it but disappointing VS the hype.

Aroma and taste is prominent apricot, with some citric lemony notes, sour fruity, with some floral notes, high carbonation, nice mouthfeel with a dry finish. Very nice indeed.

2012 On tap @ Mikkeller & Friends 2-year birthday. Pours cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma is apricots, citric acid sourness and a hint of barnyard. Medium sour. Light bodied, a bit watery texture. lively carbonation. Finish is fresh clean.

(Cantillon Fou Foune ) Bottle 750 ml at home, served into a Cantillon taster, ABV 5%
Bright orange colour on a mostly clear body, more cloudy on next pours, big white head, thin and fizzy, collapsing fast, leaving a thin line of foam around the glass.
Aroma has plenty of apricots, not very strong aroma but you can find a wide variety of apricots, peel, ripe flesh, unripe too, some 
floral notes.
Nice taste, quite sour, musty, leaves, less apricot than I expected, floral notes. 
Medium body, good carbonation. Tart on the palate. 
Nice.

75cl bottle from 2014. Aroma is is very broad spectrum! Lots and lots of apricot peel and even rotten apricot. Musty, cheesy, ascetic acid with a lemon apricot aftertaste. Its interesting to smell an almost empty glass, comparee to a freshly poured one. The latter offers a combination of co2, yeast and apricot peel/flesh. Slight pepper adds beautifully to the combination. In the end the apricot hints are isolated, which I find true craftmanship.

(bottle - 750 ml - 2013 vintage) Cloudy amber with a thin white head. Lightly fruity aroma that instantly goes tart and sour. Flavor is a sour bomb right in your face. Didnt get any apricot but I didnt care. Lots of amazing sour flavors.
Cool! Wonderful aroma of sour grapes, a little apricot. Saturated carbonated sour bright taste. Wonderful!

UPDATED: MAR 26, 2017 Poured into a taster glass showing an apricot tan and deep dark yellow with a half a finger of clean white foam. 

Sweet ripe apricots with heavy notes of brett and a light detergent like edge on the nose. 

Medium bodied, strong tartness, apricot flavor appears on the beginning & finish with a strong fruit overlay on the tartness and a high carbonation.

Bottle from Mi Orge Mi Houblon, Arlon, Belgium!

Pours pale yellow with tiny head. Smell has sour lambic notes as well as some sweet fruity notes. Starts very sourish, with lots of brett and some acidic fruit notes. Finish is extremely acidic with notes of apple, apricot and lots of brett!
Bottle. Color is murky yellow solid head. Aroma is wet sour cheese. Taste follows way sour lemon

Bottle at the brewery. Pours a hazy amber colour with a clean white head. Superb apricot aroma. Flavour is complex, with the traditional incredibly well-balanced Cantillon tartness competing with the richer sugary apricot flavours. Fine carbonation. Very tasty.

Bottle from BD ShepBush, drank at home. Pours slightly hazy deep gold, fizzy head rises and dies almost instantly. Nose of luscious juicy apricot stone fruit, big bretty funk, sour cheese, lemony citrus acidity. Tastes almost 100% dry, pretty full-on sourness, more juicy sharp apricots, natural yoghurt, lemony acidity, brett funk, buttery oak. Light body, creamyish mouthfeel, medium prickly carb, super-long sour finish with all the cheesy juicy funky elements all mingled. As expected this is superb.

Hazy golden/orange color with small white head. Hugh aroma of apricot. Smells wonderful. Taste is very sour but with a perfect balance between the harsh sourness and the fruityness from the apricot. A really, really good lambic.
Это пиво вкусное. я, конечно, рекомен& его всем, что любит хорошую Craft пива!

750ml bottle from beermerchants.com. Hazy orange amber colour with a foamy white head and aroma of apricot fruity, citric sour, slight barnyard. Taste is sour, citrus rind, hint of apricot, with yeasty & woody barnyard notes. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft carbonation, drying sour finish. Lovely stuff, very drinkable.

Another great lambic from Cantillon. Great orange colour, well balanced carbonisation, nice lambic/fruity nose. Taste is obviously quite sour, a bit disappointed on the apricot taste which is very light, not very obvious. I still prefer their Kriek, but clearly a good one...

Belle bière pâle et trouble. Au nez, on sent que les fruits sont bien présents, aucun doute. Il y a un petit quelque chose qui ménerve dans lodeur, mais jai de la difficulté à dire quoi exactement. Probablement la fermentation des abricots qui génère cette petite note collatérale. En bouche par contre: BANG! Quelle magnifique bière! Le côté surette est tellement bien balancé par les fruits quon loublie prèsque. Cest du bonbon. Je ne retrouve pas trop le côté cave/écurie/funky que jaime beaucoup dans certaines lambic/gueuze mais jen découvre un nouveau... Je crois que cest en effet ma première lambic aux fruits autres que cerises ou framboises et franchement jadore.
Peachy tart apple aroma, sour peach and apricot taste with some funky backbone, lean and vinous light carbonation great brew for sure.

Bottle '14. The pour is a peach color. The aroma is a sour fruit. The taste is mild, some sour bite but not much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2015 My 2000th rating. Have had this bottle for about 5 months. Kept in my wine fridge. Ive heard that the fruit fades on this over time, so time to drink it. The pour is golden amber, hazy, with a large light fluffy white foam head which dissipates to thin after a few minutes. Nose is delightful. Theres effervescent soda, sherbet, sour lactobacillus, apricot fruit, slight volcanic mineral note. Its far more delicate, fragrant, light and more balanced than I expected. Really delightful fruit and sherbet nose. I had the fresh apricot Cantillon at GBBF a few years back and it was bolder on the fruit and more straightforward. This is lighter. Taste is sour lactobacillus, apricot fruit, apricot stones, tart sour. The sourness is fairly lip puckering, with just enough fruit to balance it out. Very clean sourness and tartness which is good. Soft and delicate on the palate. Finish is a tingling lactobacillus tartness on the back of the tongue and throat, soda water tingle, minerals. Subtle, clean, light fruity and bold sourness. This is a refined Cantillon, worthy of the reputation. Would like to taste it fresh to get more of the fruit. 19/09/15 - on keg at The Kernel on Zwanze Day. Had a couple of thirds. In the first the fruit was barely there, and it was not far off the regular Cantillon but with a lovely apricot nose, but on the second third maybe further into the keg, theres more apricot fruit. Fou Foune is such a delicate beer and the fruit in the second third was a perfect balance. Just as stunning on keg as it was in the bottle. In a weird co-incidence I managed to bag a bottle on the same day from We Brought Beer in Balham. Score remains 4.4

che dire di questa birra, entusiasmante anche solo allapertura del tappo, tutto laroma delle albicocche esce ed inebria il locale, il colore oro torbido, la schiuma densa e persistente.
Sia al naso che in bocca si ritrova facilmente la frutta utilizzata, sapida e saporita. un sorso da non dimenticare.

(sample from bottle, thanks Blade86) Yellow, very hazy, untransparent colour. Small white head, rapidly reduced to foam. Soft carbonation, light body, watery a bit oily texture. Aroma is moderate sweet with Strong notes of apricots, medium strong aromas of brettanomyces and white wine, soft wood. In taste, very sour, a bit tart with notes of apricot. Finish is medium long,tart with soft notes of oak

Draft. Musty yeast, apricot, malt and straw aroma. Hazy golden yellow with small head. Sweet-tart apricot, malt and typical Cantillon musty flavor. Nice body. As if CBS wasnt enough, got to try this today as well.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 75cl bottle, 2014 (aug) vintage, shared by oldmanriver at his forced potluck post-Nikolaus tasting 12/2014. Fresh bottle radiating with what the fruit harvest had to offer: A cubist framing of all fruity and fresh fleshy aspects of apricot, carried by a dry & funky sour Cantillon frame: peel, flesh and pit represented in a brew so perfect and simple it becomes synonymous with unrelenting tradition, this Rhenian side of Franconia. - Will revisit aged. // Revisit aged, same AUG2014 batch in JUN2016: not the biggest fan of how Cantillons bonedry citrus bretts have gobbled up those succulent apricots - granted they did so with garce and lipsmacking fervour.

Une des plus acides. Légèrement huileuse. nez abricot et acidité. Le côté lambic de cantillon est relativement mis de côté par les abricots. Des touches de fruits type pêche également. 
Trop acide, passez de goût de lambic.
750ml bottle. Pours hazy gold with a large head. Aroma is sour and cheesy with a little peach. Taste is sour and cheesy peach to start. Not too intense. Touch of peach. Slightly watery mouthfeel.

Bottle shared with Richthevillan, cheers Rich for this top beer. Slightly hazy amber beer with large head. Aroma of apricots and some lambic notes. Taste is fruity sherbet, apricots, some cheese, light lambic action and zesty. Palate is a little chalky and a touch of oil. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Vintage 2013, vieillit 1 an. Très sour, bien acidulée et le goût de labricot est parfaitement équilibré avec les saveurs. Amertume très courte.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2016 Most kindly shared by Oldmanriver and with bartlebier and Bierle. Aromas of ripe apricots, oak and vanilla, mingled with a tender tartness. The taste is even more complex, something so rare. Bringing on an apricot universe, zooming into all stages of an apricots beautiful and simple life, from almost still green with this blackthorny sourness via its juicy, sweet and mouthwatering sourish heyday over to the near jam-like overripe stage with tartness being softened by the onset of mildly decomposing spots. Wonderful! Re-Rating 17th of June, vintage bottle most kindly shared by bartlebier, thanks a lot! nose: dried apricots and the slightly herbal notes of apricot skin all fruitier, lusher aspects have been eaten away, what remains is a beautiful and frail sketch of apricot skin, apricot tartness and something almost floral, when apricot skin flavor gets diluted to tender vineyard peach skin to herbs, wood and flowers. Ganz großes Kino!

Pours a lightly clouded yellow gold with light fluffy white head. Aroma is apricot heavy, must, light lacto, orange, farmhouse, peach. Flavor is apricot city, med sour, fairly tart, dry.. Very fruity. This is an extremely beautiful beer.

Pours a cloudy orange/yellow with a nice fluffy white head. Looks marvelous. Aroma was very odd to me. I was expecting some fruit burst with apricot, but it was more like a vinegar and sour beer smell. Taste was almost dead on to me for a standard sour. I got some hay, barnyard funk, and tartness to it. Im not sure if I was just expecting more, or my tastes are off, or I drank a bad one. Not bad, and sours dont bother me, but I was thinking this would be 100% different. Light body and well carbed.

Draught at Borefts. Considering the way the kegs are being butchered at the bar, it looks good - clear, pale, slight head. Aroma of peach skins and old-school homemade lemonade, and a bit of the farmyard. Flavour is lemon juice cut with effervescent peach, fizzes off the palate into long, sour and dry finish. A wonderful beer, classic lambic imbued with the essence of peach.

Corked 75 cl bottle @ home (2014 vintage). Pours hazy yellow with a white head that leaves a little lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemons, apricots, lactose, and a little funk - with a slightly dry finish.

On tap at Capones 2014 Black Friday. Pours a completely cloudy orangey yellow without a head. Aromas of apricots, sour lacto aroma, slight farm funk. Taste is at the upper end of sour for a drinkable beer. Medium light body and medium light carb. Really enjoyable. One of my favorite Cantillon beers althought it was a tad bit overly sour.

Cloudy orange with frothy white head. Smell is fruity with just a bit of funk. Taste is quite tart with some nice stone fruit notes. Medium body with very good carbonation making it very easy drinking and refreshing. Definitely one of the best fruit lambics.
Yellow hazy with rich white head. Sweet fryuity aroma. Sour lambic taste with rich fruity taste on background. MIld sourness remains.

Last bottle at Fermentoren Aarhus. Had this a couple of times under less good circumstances. Pours cloudy yellow-amber with a small white head. Aroma has lots of both acidic and more ripe apricot and some peach as well. Funky yeast, slight vinegar and dry leather. Taste is very bitter and sour up front, but turns more sweet and fruity, and ends off with some more bitterness. Very fruity. Prominent apricots, and reminds me of a Danish skyr-snack with apricots. Sparkling, fresh body. Really a lovely lambic!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

duft: fersken. sødme. grøn duft. vindruer
smag. fersken sød lidt lime lidt druer meget fersken

Bottle at home 2014 vintage. Aroma is barnyard funk, hay. Foamy white head thats quite active on an, unsurprisingly, apricot colour body. Taste is medium sour, medium tart with hints of sweet and apricot on the short finish. Lovely beer and well balanced, not overpowering in any sense.

P: Hazy orange with a thin white head that sticks and never leaves. S: Lots of oak, barnyard smell, loaded with apricots, tropical fruits, floral yeast and a bit of wheat. T: A ton of apricots that coat your entire mouth like freaking apricot syrup, you get that oak, yeast, wheat, some sugar but the apricots just dominate with greek yogurt tartness to finish it all. M: Really light with soft carbonation and light sourness. O: An apricot sour beer with nothing odd, just damn good.

Bottle shared with my lab, put cashed form the brewery a few weeks ago. Some liquid between the cork and cap, which I though was a little odd. Hazy yellow pour with a slight Amber orange tinge to it. Nice nose, fruit and a bit of funk. Sour, but not highly sour. Nice apricot in the taste as well.

Sample of both 2013 and 2012 bottles at (Hopp)Kurtkeller 016: Cantillon-tastic 01 on 10/11/2014. Pale orange color with tiny bubbles attached to the glass, and a medium thin foamy white head that recedes steadily to a film. Small patches of lacing on the glass. Aroma of funky fruit, yeast and wheat. Light-bodied with flavors of apricots, citrus, yeast and malt. The finish is fruity with an apricot and floral yeast aftertaste. Excellent beer all around.

Bottle, 2014 vintage. Less than 3 months old. Pours a hazy glowing orange-gold with small white head. Highly aromatic and fruity nose, there is bright apricots upfront with citrus and the usual Cantillon barnyard funk. Taste is well balanced. Lactic acidity is not too intense per Cantillon standards. Fruitiness is sweet and sour. This one is better fresh from the few expériences Ive had. Palate is light, carbonation is rather low (only light flaw). This isnt the most complex lambic, but very few flaws and the nose is amazing.
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Pas trop fan des lambics à la base, labricot ne fait que rajouter de lacidité au tout.
Bottled in 2012. Wow. Pours a hazy golden with a resilient layer of cream colored head. Aroma and taste of fruit, sour, dry wine. Amazing balance and taste.

(On tap at barVolo for Zwanze Day 2014, Sept 20 2014) Hazy medium gold with a dense, lingering white head. Aroma apricot, blue cheese, grass, floral, lightly sour. Palate initial light vinegar and lactic yoghurt mixed with some fresh apricot, cheese and woody notes in the middle, lingering lactic acid and a dried apricot aftertaste. Very clean finish with no bitterness. Light body and very soft carb. The apricots arent overpowering here but theyre still prominent yet held in perfect balance so as to not overwhelm all the other complex flavours going on. Just delightful to drink, an amazing beverage for a sunny patio (or anywhere).
Has a hazy, orange/peach colour. Sharp aroma with some vinegar and apricot syrup. Very smooth and easy to drink for a sour beer. Its tangy but sugary sweet too giving some balance.

Hazy, peach color with a fizzy head that quickly dissipates. Not very aroma-iffic, but it does exixhibit some yeasty must, white wine vinegar, vague soft fruits. The flavor is very acidic, tart, and sour, but I dont get much apricot. However, after having a bite of greasy or rich food, the sour cuts through and the apricot is definitely there. The beer is medium light and well carbonated. Overall, this is a great beer and I like it, but I just dont have an overly refined palate for sours yet.

UPDATED: APR 1, 2015 750ml bottle with cap and cork served in a Thumbler glass.
Bottle from 20th of August, 2012. 
A: Pours a light orange color forming a small white fizzy and very bubbled head. Small retention and no lacings formed or left. 
S: Very fruity. Strong notes of apricots and peaches. Lambic yeasts. Metallic. Vinegar. Light notes of malts. 
T: Very fruity. Again, mainly apricots and peaches. Lambic yeasts. Slightly sweet upfront. In overall, a dry and tart taste, however, much lighter acidity if compared with the Lou Pepes, for example. A little bit metallic with light notes of malts. A very light bitterness can be felt in the very end. Quite smooth and pleasant taste
M: Light body, good carbonation. Smooth fruity aftertaste. Quite good taste of peach left in the mouth
O: Excellent drinkability. Excellent fruit beer. Mandatory to Cantillon fans, independently of the hype around it
[ BA Review @ 2/1/2013 ]

Pours a hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is Swedish julmust and sweet apricot candies. It has a very nice drieness. Taste is sour, sweet and peppery with lots of apricots. A near to perfect lambic.

Spina @ Eurhop 2014.
Chiara torbida bella schiuma.
Corpo abbastanza vellutato, pesca ed il solito acido cantillon.

Tap tasting at Borefts 2014, Boegraven Netherlands. Light orange color, hazy, white head. Funky aromas, appricot, ornge, with a touch of sweet fruits. Taste is sour, funky and sweet at the absolute correct level, with notes of appricot, orange and hay. Nice aftertaste, long. Light to medium body with medium aftertaste. Great!!!!

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden, with big, but short lasting white head. Quite carbonated for a sour. Aroma is sweet apricot, tart, apples, hint of peach. Taste is upfront sour and tart. As it warms more sweet fruits and clean apricot. Fizzy on the tounge. Long sour finish with some green apples.
Bottle @ Fermentoren. Hazy pale orange, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma and taste, malty, tart, apricot, candy, grass, perfume, . Very sour taste.

On tap at Borefts 2014. Not my first choice, but this was an excellent replacement. Sour as hell at the first few sips. Once I got used to it I started tasting the Lambic and a distinct (dried) apricot taste. The latter made it actually a bit sweeter. A very nice beer to drink as a step away from the beers I usually have.
On tap at Borefts Festival 2014. Comes a somewhat hazy golden orange with a small white head. Aroma of fruit and barnyard. Taste is tart fruit, apricot, barnyard, and wood. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 21, 2015 10/2/2014
Tap at Borefts 2014. Pours hazy orange-yellow with a almost not-existing white head/edges. Aromas of apricots, vinegar, yeast, stable and yoghurt. Taste is pretty fruit forward, vinegar, green sour apples, tart apricot, stable-like notes. Finish is pretty sweet but tart fruits. Pretty low carbonation because of the pours from Cantillon which werent from bottles. Cant wait to drink my bottle of this with more carbonation.
9-4-9-3-17

11/20/2014
Bottle at Fermentoren. Pours hazy golden with a medium white head. Aromas of apricots, slight vinegar, stable, barnyard. Taste is very fruit forward, vinegar, some yeast, funk, slight leather and barnyard. 
9-5-9-4-18

12/6/2014
Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a slightly brown tint. White medium head. Aromas of funk forward, sweet peaches, tart apricots, apricot/peach yoghurt, slight leather and some barnyard. Taste is sweet peaches, apricots, some tart apricots and some yoghurt, vinegar, hay and some funk and dry woody notes in the back. This bottle is pretty sweet compared to the last one I got? Anyway, I really like it. 
9-4-9-4-18

UPDATED: JUL 20, 2016 Bottle 2014 vintage. Poured in my Cantillon glass. Hazy golden body with a medium frothy white head. Apricots, yeast, fruit, tart, basement aromas. Tart yeast, fruity, apricot flavors. Delicious. I think this is a new favorite from Cantillon.

2013 bottle. Pours a golden orange, a bit hazy, nice 2 finger white head. Aromas of light apricot, wet oak, musty notes and a lingering tartness. (Stings the nostrils!) Taste is much more subdued in terms of the apricot flavors than I expected. Much more wet oak, tart citrus zest and earth...along with slight notes of vinegar and a slight bitterness. Carbonation is pretty lively and this finishes pretty dry. Very nice Lambic and glad to have tried it, but not my favorite Cantillon offering.
Borefts 2014. Poured hazy orange, frothy off white head. Aroma of tart apricot. Light body, flavour as the aroma, lovely and tart, very refreshing and nicely balanced.

@Borefts 2014, Oranje/geel zonder kraag. Aroma van licht zoetje over een basis zuur. Smaken zijn matig zacht zuur(niet extreem) maar redelijke vorm van zoetigheid. tja veel van de lambic bieren smaken nagenoeg het hetzelfde deze is wat gebalanceerder, komt wat zachten en iets zoeter binnen.
2013 release. Very carbonated. Lots of apricot. Slight sour. Wierd finish, still apricot, but like the unsweetened part by the pit. Had this right after blabær, Ill put them on the same level.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2016 15cl tasting @ Borefts Beer Festival. Hazy orange, creamy offwhite head. Apricot rounds off some typical big tard, vinegar lambiek-ness. High carbonation, prickly but creamy soft mouthfeel, good body. 
25.10.2016 75cl bottle at home, 2016 ed. Idem.

"2011 batch - wish list cross off. BIG fruit aroma and flavor...definitely not subtle with the apricot, but its more than balanced out by the sourness that while not overaggressive, gets me in the back o the jaw after a few sips. light bodied and refreshing while also being quite tasty and complex."

UPDATED: DEC 24, 2016 9/26/2014 On tap at Borefts. Hazy yellow with a small white head. Sour fruity aroma of apricot and wood. Taste is very sour fruity, apricot, wood, long sour fruity aftertaste. Very nice. 7/4/8/4/16 12/24/2016 Bottle at Broer & Zus, Beverwijk, (bottled 29 augustus 2016). Aroma has lots of apricot, lemony tartness, funk. Taste is sour, sweet apricots, funk. Lemony sour apricot aftertaste. Nice

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2015 Tap at Borefts 2014. Hazy orange with small white head. Fruit pits, dry sour apricot, lots of sour grains with complex spicyness. Lots of wood too. Very deep sour with a light bitter finish. Pretty good stuff! 3.9

Update 2015 bottle. Slightly more fruity with dried apricot, orange. Quite some barnyard funk with light hay and a touch of cheese. Way less sour. Great

On tap at Zwanze Day. Hazy orange colour and fluffy white head. Apricots and tart in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is dry with some sweet notes and a tart finish. Not so much apricots in the flavour. Overall, an interesting Lambic but no so complex.

Smell is apricot and a bit of vinegar. Taste is very sour with lots of lactic and acetic sourness plus the lovely note of apricots that brings it all together. This is my favorite Cantillon that I have had.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2015 Pours hazy lemon yellow, fluffy white ring. Acidic lemon, apricot, cedar on the nose. Real light refined body with a super lemon sour tartness thats drying on the finish.
Hazy orange with small white head. Aroma is apricot marmalade and some funk. Fruity and sour palate. Aftertaste is funk, citric and apricot finish. Overall: nice apricot aromas. Lacks complexity.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2016 On tap at Erzbierschof for Zwanze Day 2014. Hazy yellow-orange color with large fluffy head. Apricot gelee in the aroma, blending nicely into the lambic aromas. Not that funky. Taste is dry and lambicly sour, but balanced. Very balanced. Medium carbonation! High-level Cantillon brew.From the bottle, Vintage 2003, drank at Erzbierschof Vintage Tasting in October 2014. Damn, goes very much into a Gueuze in terms of funk, and its very sour, but still incredibly fruity.
Fresh 2016 bottle, 2006 bottle and tap at Zwanze 16: 
tap: Very good and lots of apricot jelly, but also some milky yeastiness. On a fresh palate, its great, but next to the bottles, the intensity of flavours was quite weak.

2016 bottle: So much jelly, very creamy. Way tastier than the tap.

2006 bottle: more funk, more apricot, deeper. Funky, more sour. Extremely fruity, but very dry.

another 2006 bottle which was slightly oxidized: a bit more vinegary, but still amazing. Would probably not really have noticed if the beers werent side by side.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 2014 on Tap [8-4-7-3-17]

Aroma of apricot, like apricot purée, with some hints of acidity. Not so much apricot on taste, more so towards gueuze, very well balanced, with some tartness, some metallic off feel, but not a great mouthfeel.

2013 version, in 2014.

Tart barnyard quite funky smelling beer with prominent acidity, not a lot of apricot on nose and very faint apricot presence which opens up around 30 minutes later, but still faint. Taste mimicks aroma, but its quite straight ahead and not very complex, acidity, some funk, not much more to it.
[7-4-7-3-14]
0,33 kaadettu lasiin@ pikkulintu. Kaunis samea, meripihkan kultainen. Kirpakka aprikoosin tuoksu, lambickmainen. Hieman hiivaa. Aprikoosia ja kirpeää marjaa, kuivahkoa.

Shared bottle, poured a slight hazy orange golden colour. Some sweeter fruity aroma, apricots, barnyard, oak, murky hop, medium sour because of the fruits, tart, vineous notes, grains, not my favourite fruit lambic

Poured from bottle to glass. Hazy golden orange hue with fizzy white head. Aroma is lactic, apricot, funk, straw, peppercorn. Mouthfeel is great with a medium light body and zesty carbonation. Taste is dry sweetness with spicy following and sour tart finish. Overall this is a nice brew...but I actually expected a bit more.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl, couleur abricot très trouble, effervescence importante peu de mousse. jattendais beaucoup de cette foufoune, mais jai été plutôt déçu. Grosse attaque au nez sur labricot tout comme en bouche, mais cest plus lacidité de labricot qui prend le dessus en plus de lacidité du Lambic. Alors oui larrière goût dabricot du soleil est là mais ce nest quun arrière goût, juste dommage. A regoûter

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 Classic Cantillon fruit lambic, with real Bergeron apricots to which the label playfully refers; yellowish and hazy robe, powerful aroma with all the Cantillon funkiness one can expect, very fruity from esters as well as apricots, barnyard, sherry, sweat, sour cream, taste very Cantillon - in other words, lots of neige citric acid, lots of lactic acid, lots of funkiness, uncompromisinly sour yet very complex, woody, very dry, with the apricots shining through nicely. One of their many masterpieces.
Tap. Pours hazy yellow with white head. Aroma very fruity, sweet apricot, stone fruits. Very dry, tart, tons of apricot flavor! Light, easy, really great!

Appearance: Clear golden amber with cm thick white head.
Aroma: Apricot, leather, barnyard, citrus, vinous note.
Taste: Medium/high sourness, low/medium bitterness with low sweetness.
Palate: Light/medium thick coarse texture, light/medium body, prickly carbonation, lingering, dry, tart fruity, apricot, vinous finish.
Comments: Good. Bottled 28th August 2012.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ 2014. Lambic fort effervescent, court en bouche dominé par des saveurs de macarons acidulé. Le nez fruité développe des effluves damande, dabricots avec une amertume herbacée. En bouche la bière est trop effervescente. Son malt fromenté est assez doux, mais immature au point dexacerber les sensations acides de labricot au détriment du fruit mais moins agressif que la Kriek tout en laissant sur le palais un doux sirupeux peu amer sur des notes minérales. A faire mûrir et à regoûter plus tard.

2008 bottle. Aroma: Pear, chardonnay, sour apricot, Medium-intense tartness that evolves.
Flavors: Tart pear, apricot fruit, vinegar, bitter apricot and ume skins. Lingering blend of tart fruit on the finish.
Comment: Very special and great mix of slightly viscous aged nectar and vinegar.
Hazy orange/yellow pour with a white head. Light citrus and apricot/peach aroma and some tropical rain. Flavor is sour apricot/orange. Pretty damn tasty.
Rusty Orange. Strong funky aroma - tart, fruity. Taste is lots of funk, sour, slight vinegar, oak, with a nice apricot tang. Unreal
Bottle 750 ml. Shared by Tom10101, thanks! Pours goldn whit a thin white head. Aroma: apricot, jujube, green apple. Taste: interesting fruity acidity. A good fruit lambic.
Pale gold colored beer with a little head. Aromas of apricots and salt. Taste is very sour and salty, but while warming up turns over to a subtile sweet apricot tastes.

Bottle thanks to northernbrews for sharing. Aug 2013 bottling. Very cloudy, pale yellow-orange pour with a small foamy head that fades very slowly. Aroma is pretty funky with lots of yogurt, damp basement, and citrus-y fruit. Taste starts with a bunch of sour, acidic citrus fruit. Doesnt really taste like apricots but its definitely citrus-y. Lots of oak and some vinegar too. Sourness is moderate, strong tart finish. Love the soft but fizzy carbonation. Really good beer but I thought I was gonna like this more than I did since its a favorite for a few of my friends.
Bottle at home. Pours hazy golden, tart, tangy apricot, quite funky, fruity.

750ml Bottle pours a hazy golden color. A lot of froth if not poured slowly. Poured at fridge temperature although recommended at cellar temperature. Strong sourness and mild apricots. The sourness mellowed as it warmed and balanced well against the apricot.
Amazing gueuze lambic, very complex and full of different tastes, so enjoyable, very sour, grains, cereals, wild fruity and flowery notes. Lot of fruits. Masterpiece!

Bottled. Pours slightly hazy, deep golden with a small, lacing, white head. Aroma of apricotbarnyard and wood. Sweet flavor that ends up dru and more sour. Medium bodied, watery texture and soft carb. An excellent Sour.

Wonderful apricot smell. Not too overpowering just perfect. Beautiful sour base, then wonderful apricot flavors. Not stale apricot but very ripe apricots. Great use of the natural fermentation almost cask like.

On tap at Akkurat. Pours hazy orange with a minimal white head. Aroma is hay, citrus, tart apples, light apricots and oak. Taste is tart with citrus notes, light apricot notes, dry tart finish with barnyard notes.

A- peach color, slightly cloudy, small head that fades quite quickly

S- peach, apricot, light fruit

T- light peach notes up front followed by a wave of sourness that washes over the tongue and finishes with peach, apricot and pleasant wheat notes

M- medium bodied and effervescent.

D- absolutely phenomenal beer. Lightly sour, wheaty, absolutely delicious.

UPDATED: MAY 26, 2014 Je pourrais passer le reste de la soirée à respirer ce que ce liquide moffre, le goût ne décoit pas mais le nez...LE NEZ! La chair folle est vraiment plus puissante en arome mais en bouche le noyau émerge et percute mes papilles sans relache....LE NEZ!

what a brew...I opened it a week after I bought it so its really fresh. The pour is a murky, muddy orange with a shimmering head that fills the glass like a fine champagne. The nose is musty and farmhouse noted with big juicy apricot notes as well as a generally heavy acetic undertone. Big musty and dusty barrel notes with solid acetic and sour notes in the late middle blend well with soft sweetness and fruit flavour. Quite acidic and sour overall but put in balance by the fruit sweetness. overall, one of the best beers to touch my lips.

Pours a cloudy straw orange with an enthusiastic fizzy white champagne head diminishing rapidly to a thin white cap and no lacing. Nose is initially barnyard and sour apple cider, but lemon, stone fruit - yes, apricot - and a little vinous oak come through as it warms. Taste is juicy stone fruit just sweet enough to balance out the malt vinegar sourness. Mouth feel is light with sustained carbonation, with a lingering dry puckered finish.

This is an extremely well-done fruit lambic. The flavours are integrated, with none of the artificial cough syrup characteristic sometimes found in other lambics or krieks. Very even-tempered and extremely drinkable. If it werent for the price, Id call this a well-nigh perfect beer.

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2015 Light apricots smell, again the typical cantillon nose is coming through and hits you  on your head. Orange body with a foamy head. Fizzy carbonation. Sour - of course, apricot. I love Apricots. The fresher, the better for me perosnally. If you age this, the experience is totally different, much less fruity.

One of my favorite Cantillons. Hay and lemons leads you on to a track and field race with lovely apricots and other stone fruits. Right amount of sourness to keep the apricots on the centre stage and still be on top of the fruit sweetness.

Hazy orange body with medium creamy head. Aroma is pretty sweet on the nose and has pear, apricot, peach. Taste has apricot sweetness, short lasting sour after taste, dry. Body is full, medium to high carbonation.

Bouteille 750ml. Couleur dorée trouble, mousse blanche pétillante et fugace laissant une dentelle évanescente. Arôme de brett, abricot, fruité, un brin floral, vineux. Goût de peau dabricot, chair dabricot, levures sauvages, cuir, bonne acidité, légère astringence. Carbonatation élevée, corps moyen.

Bottle shared by Dave. Pours slightly murky but I got the end of the bottle. Aroma is fruity with some barnyard. Light hay and lemon. Taste is similar with some lightly puckering. Overall, very nice balance of fruitiness and sour.

Pours a hazy light orange color with huge rocky white head. Huge, dominant apricot aroma with the funky barnyard character in the back. Funky, tart, barnyard, sweet, flavor...fruity, peach/apricot flavor comes through in the finish. Very juicy, fruity, tasty overall with a mild sourness.
In bottiglia. Colore giallo paglierino, schiuma abbondante e mediamente persistente. Aroma di limone, solvente. Al palato aroma di frumento, acidità spiccata, aspra. Aromi delicati ed intensi.

An extremely enjoyable lambic that hits all the top marks for fruit delivery, bright acidity, pulpiness (body) and aroma. The pour leaves a large frothy foam, you can already smell the hallmark stone fruit aromas.. The sourness of the French apricots really comes through as this beer ages. A 2002 bottle sampled at Captain Lawrence in 2009 was nearly undrinkable due to acidity, however 2005 bottlings Ive opened recently have been much more integrated. The demi 2008 Japanese bottling shared most recently in Maine this December was extremely tart and almost enamel stripping, but had a more subdued nature than previous vintages with the same amount of age. Really like to drink this fresh but aging can be a rewarding exercise of patience.

UPDATED: MAY 2, 2014 On tap @chez moeder lambic and bottle sample @Cantillon Quintessence 2014. Pours cloudy yellow with white foam. Sour and fruity, apricot aroma. Taste sour, little bitterness, fruity, apricot.  Dry finish.  I preferred the bottle version which was more intense.  Rating given is the one for the bottle. Tap version : 6/10, 3/5, 6/10, 3/5, 12/20.

2004 bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Hazy orange color, some white head. Aroma is perfect, sweet, fruits, sour notes, apples, maybe perry. Taste is sour apples, fruits, some sweet notes on the back, balanced. Aroma is better than taste.
Tap at Pikkulintu, Helsinki. Colour is deep orange with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, apricot, some sweetness and massive sourness.
