UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 sampled @ Borefts Beer Festival 2014: milchig trüb, golden, wenig Schaum. Geruch säuerlich, reife Früchte. Geschmack nach reifen Früchten, säuerlich.

Bottle at Café des Spores. Pours a luminous orange--almost apricot--color with small fluffy head. Aroma is about the best one could imagine for this sort of beer: ripe farmers market apricot, lemon, orange marmalade, slight farmhouse Brett character. So juicy and inviting. Taste is apricot jam, sour plum, peaches, light bitter almond, a beautiful mixture of sweet and tart. Long finish. Just so good.

Intense beer. Stron sour body of lambic, with a acid tardiness that tries to burn through your mouth. Smooth gentle taste abricot after that. Some horseblanket and vanilla as well. Real wild beer art from the masters of Cantillon.

Bottle shared at Schouskjelleren, october 1st 2013. Hazy orange body, small lasting white head. Funky aroma with blue veined cheese, leather, apricot. Taste is sour with ripe fruits and the same blue veined cheese tones. Lasting funky yeast aftertaste. An excellent experience

Hand drawn at Backcountry on Sour Sunday. Pours hazy orange with very small white head, settles almost instantly with no lacing. Aroma is tart, funky, musty, barnyard, oaky, apricot, mild vinegar, acidic. Flavor is moderately tart, building slightly, dried apricot, with an oaky, tart, vinegar, mildly vinous finish and lingering oaky, sour apricot aftertaste. Delicious. Minimal carbonation allows flavors to come through. Very soft carbonation, light body, smooth and mildly juicy texture. Interested in comparing bottled version to taste it with more substantial carbonation.

Thanks drowland for snagging a bottle. Pours a milky orange. Apricots abound in the aroma, both sweet and tart. Some oak in the nose. Taste is perfectly tart and sweet apricots. Just a little sour and a hint of acidity. Medium bodied with nice carbonation, a little dryness. Magnificent!
On tap at Falling Rock. Pale cloudy appearance with a white head. Aroma of apricots and funky yeast. Similar flavor, fruity, tart and sour, finishing dry. Quite quaffable.

750 ml bottle poured into a tulip. Bottled August 30, 2013. Pours a very cloudy pale yellow color with a bit of off-white head. Aromas of vinegar, tart fruit, stone fruit, light oak. Tasting notes of big vinegar and acidity, big mouth puckering tart and sour fruit, stone fruit including apricots, subtle oak. Maybe just a hint of funk but its overshadowed by the tart and sour notes. Medium-light body with a very dry finish. Low carbonation, light and juicy mouthfeel. Goes down like fruit juice. One of the best fruit lambics Ive had.
Bottle at Moeder Lambic. Sour taste with apple, acidic notes, earthy notes, ripe fruit, toast and grapefruit. Sour finish with apple, ripe fruits, acidic notes and toast. Excellent lambic.

Bottle, four years old. Thanks to KyotoLefty. Great funky nose, lots of apricot, and light-scented calf manure. Hazy honey straw color. Mouth-, throat-, and stomach-puckering sourness hits like razor blades. Apricot, rhubarb, and celery. Bitter fruit pits. Small light peppery notes in finish.Thin and astringent. Wow! This is wonderful. Tangy, sharp, and flavor packed. Four years and tastes as fresh as can be.

Bottle of the 2012. Cloudy orange with a good sized white head, most of which dissipated quickly. Aroma is apricot, sour candy, hint of vinegar. Acidic on the palate with a reasonably sweet fruity background. Taste is fresh apricots, dried apricots, dried peach, sour candy, cider vinegar. Tasty and apricoty.

750ml bottle (13) pours cloudy pale orange with a finger of head. Nose is funky tart citrus, subtle apricot, hay, peach. Taste is sour funky citrus, apricot, orange peel, peach, dusty wood, barnyard. Finish is tart slightly acidic funky dried apricot, peach, orange, touches of grain, dry woody funk. Great.

Bottle shared at the Sybarite Pig. Small snifter. Pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Very little lacing. The aroma is tart light fruits, bacteria yeasts, light malts. The taste is simply amazing with tart apricots, citrus, sour yeasts, and almost a slight lemon finish. So damn refreshing and light, but full of flavor every sip. Great carbonation. Tart finish.

Was really surprised to see this show up at the bottle shop, pours a very murky orange-yellow with a big bubbly white head that fades. Aroma strong barnyard funk, hay and horse blanket, over ripe fruit, lacto. Taste is very sour at first, smooths out after a few sips, but still stays tart, funky, hay, a short lived bitterness that goes back to fruity and tart with tons of funk and some of the apricot as well, finishes very dry. Delicious, hope to have it again.

On tap at winking lizard barrel aged fest. Pours hazy lemon yellow, fluffy white ring. Acidic lemon, apricot, cedar on the nose. Real light refined body with a super lemon sour tartness that's drying on the finish. Almost perfection 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Probada en el aniversario de Cevezorama, en barril. No es fácil probar Cantillon en barril y no podía desaprovechar la ocasión. Excelente ejemplo de creación. Olor muy agradable que mezcla el acético, láctico y el toque de fruta. En boca más mezcla, empiece dulce y el inequívoco retrogusto ácido matizado por el melocotón. Espuma muy blanca y poco persistente. Para tomar litros, con un Almax en la mano.

Bottle. Gold pour, white head, little retention/lace. Aroma of citrus, lactic, funk, barrel, lemon, mineral. Taste is tart, lactic, funky, light barrel, mineral, lemon. Palate is dry, soft, slick, tart finish. Good stuff.

My first Cantillon! Finally. Large format bottle from Tipples, capped and corked, with an Aug 30, 2013 bottling date. Cracked Feb 9, 2014. Pours into my tulip hazy apricot yellow with a very large fluffy and fizzy white head that dissipates relatively quickly. Aroma of apricots, lacto, yeast funk, dusty dryness. This smells both mouthpuckeringly dry and sour. Flavor is apricots up front and tart lemons, with another punch of sour in the middle. Finishes dry but soft with oak and apricots lingering with an extra lacto sour punch. Light bodied with medium to high carbonation. A yummy sour beer with lots to like. Looking forward to trying my Kriek now....ok as this warms it just gets better and better with more and more apricot coming out. Now I know why this is considered one of the best. Awesome, awesome brew.

A - pours hazy very light apricot with low head. S - holy apricots batman! Aromas of dried and fresh apricot. Typical loon funk and must. Nice eggy funk. M - lightly spritzy. Medium body. Watery feel. Nice tartness. T - apricoty goodness, lemon juice, mineral water. Yeasty and loon funky. 4.1

750ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy golden/copper with a white head. Aroma of apricots and peach, light sourness, tart notes, light wood notes, funkiness, and light malts. Flavor great blend of the fruits, the tartness and funkiness, and the lightness. Average texture for the style. A great beer.

Tasted @ Cervezorama Beerfestival. Pale glden colour with a white head with long presence. Aroma is slightly citrus, acidic and notes of apricot. Acidic flavor, moderate vinegar mouthfeel, fruity notes , mainly apricot and fresh wood. Mild acidic final with a dry mouthfeel.
Tap at Tuulensuu. Pours hazy yellow, small white head. Tart apricot aroma. Tart smooth earthy apricot flavor.

Half bottle  part of a 5-bottle peach/apricot sour blind tasting, Aroma is that classic acidic funk that smells like a barnyard floor, but with a slight citrus, apricot and orange zest twist. The more the beer gets swirled in the glass the more the apricot comes out. The beer pours a cloudy yellow orange with a thin film sitting on top of the liquid. As the beer goes down there are rings of lace left behind. Taste is initially sour, with notes of hay, grass, citrus and finally the lactic apricot flesh. There are lasting flavors of grapefruit, lemon and some barrel tannins. As the beer warms up the tannin flavor gets a bit more aggressive. The body is somewhat creamy with high carbonation. The finish is very dry, sour and zaps all the saliva out of your mouth leaving apricot on your tongue. Overall an extremely inviting fruited sour with complex barnyard layers that is truly one of a kind.
010214. Tap at Tuulensuu, Tampere. Pours hazy yellow with a minimal head. Aroma sour fruit, apricot. Still a bit juice like, needs more sour :) Not Bad.

Barril en el festival cervezorama. Color oro pálido turbio con una espuma blanca que desaparece rápido. Aromas dulces y ácidos y muy a frutadis. En boca el inicio es dulce con el toque de albaricoque que empalma con una acidez muy equilibrada y duradera. Rica, aunque no de locura.

Shared bottle at the brewery. Muddy yellow orange body with a fingerthick white head. Super inviting fresh apricots dominate the nose with wooden notes present. Sour grapefruit and other fruity flavors in the mouth. Medium bodied. Smoothish to drink but astringent tendencies and notes of cereal late in the finish.
Gammel Note: Serveret på flaske. Duft: 9 ud af 10. /suv? Udseende: 8 ud af 10. Smag: 7 ud af 10. Lidt for syrlig hen mod slutningen.

750 ml bottle, served in a tumbler. Bottled on 30-08-2013. Bright orange colour, pretty clear when carefully poured. My first ever experience with a Cantillon and with any kind of sours as well. First reaction during the smell: wow! I can honestly say Ive never smelt something like this, perhaps its too complex and over the top for me. Definitely some mature apricot pulp, notes of cellar/old basement, acidic lemon meringue, white grapes and cheese. Very fruity in the mouth, pretty sour but fortunately not something overpowering for an uneducated palate like mine. Light to medium body, lively carbonation, extremely smooth and drinkable, like a fine prosecco or a sparkling fruity white wine. Lingering fruity aftertaste that lasts seriosly forever. Mind blowingly good, Im hooked and my wallet is going to complain pretty soon.
UPDATED: OCT 23, 2014 Bottle shared by Adam! Poured from a basket into ballon glass, aroma is strong funky apricots, taste is tart funk with a strong apricot and funky finish, amazing beer

Bottle from mane liquor on Xmas! Pours a light golden with light fluffy head that fizzes out. Nose shows lovely sweet apricot, barnyard funk, citrus and some lemon. Taste is dominated by sour apricot, a lemony pepper hint, medium mouthfeel carries the carbonation all the way through. Heard good things about this beer and lives up to it! 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour an unclear yellow, with a beautiful white and slightly fluffy head.
Aroma of classic Cantillon funk and barnyard, with a lot of fruity notes to it. Citrus, lemon peel, peach, unripe apricot, apricot jam, sour sweets. Some slightly earthy notes in here as well. This sure is a sour treat. 
The taste is dominant sour, but has plenty of fruity sweet notes to it. Slight bitterness in here somewhere. 
Medium bodied, with a rather fizzy carb, and a somewhat dry mouthfeel.

on tap @ La Capsule, Lille - FRANCE. Color: nice clear golden beer with small carbonation and small white foam. Smell: nice acid and sweet smell equilibrium with a mango notes. Taste: acid and sugar taste. Aftertaste: nice acidity with sugar not so persistent.

Shared 750 ml bottle @ home. Pours hazy golden with a very small head. Aroma is tart and funky with unripe peaches. Taste is nicely balanced sourness with the peaches really coming out in the finish. Great beer!

2013 btl. Looks..apricot/yellow med murky med head. Smells.. Apricots, and the brett funk and still more slightly unripe apricot. Tastes.. Apricots, just unripe enough and just sweet enough lots of brett funk, some slight sparkling vinous notes, finishes dry. Hello summer
Delicious. Like a slightly un-ripe apricot. And those are the best kind of apricots.

In assoluto una delle birre più buone del mondo. Il fruttato rilevante e accattivante delle albicocche è accompagnato dal sentore acido netto che ci si aspetta da un maestro come cantillon. Ogni volta che mi trovo davanti a un bicchiere di Fou Foune comprendo la ragion dessere di qualcosa come le birre artiginali. Le birre artigianali esitono affiché possa esitere un miracolo come la Fou Foune di Cantillon.

Bottle (Bottled 28.aug 2012). Pours a cloudy pale orange with a large head. Diminishes rapidly to a centimetre thick without leaving any lacings. Flowery aroma with loads of peach and apricot. Mellow tartness and acidity, and a faint hint of wood. Taste is refreshingly sour with high levels of carbonation. Fantastic citrusy, acidic fruityness. Fizzy on the palate. Dry finish witch leaves a light bitter, acidic touch. Doesnt get much better than this! :)

Huge thanks to Jake for sharing this one. Bottle that was apparently pretty fresh. Pours gold, murky, some white head. Aroma of barnyard peaches diaper fruitylicious yeah! Cantillon. Taste:fruit, peach, really surprisingly dry; funky but not tart. So nice. Dirty and great. Wait, this is apricot? Man, I really dont know my fruits. I suck. This beer doesnt suck, though -- this beer is pretty damned tasty.

November 26, 2013 - attack of the fruited sours continues. Light orange pour with large amount of head that lasted for a while. Aroma was a little bit sour, but also a nice sweet light fruit / apricot and some yeast / barnyard funk came through as it warmed. I am just digging this interesting aroma. The taste was nicely balanced. Some tartness in there, but well balanced by the sweet fruit and the funky yeast. Had the Cascade Apricot right before and this just blows it away. 2012 vintage. Happy Birthday Darcy!

golden hazy, small white foam; apricot, floral, acidic aroma; heavy sourness, lightly sweet; light body, thin feel, average carbonation, long sour, fruity finish;
Overall: yet another very good beer from Cantillon
Notes from backlog. Oh dear, what a powerful flavor! Overpowering acidity, and really made me do my "happy sour face". Hints of apricot are present, but mostly just citrusy and vinegar sourness.

Bottle @ tasting, courtesy of kermis. Pours a light blonde, murky apricot coloured beer with a very small, quickly fading off white head. Aroma is apricot funk, light brett and a touch of oak. Flavor is medium sweet with a fruity tartness in the back. Very fresh and fizzy on the tongue. Very nice to drink this beer. Nice!

Bottle courtesy of Kermis. Poured a murky light brown with a round white head. The aroma is big apricot citrus and yeast. The flavour is medum sour with a strong acidic sour palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation and a thin texture. This beer would go very well with many different types of food. Wine move over!

75cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks.
Thin white head. Sludgy pale orange pour. Sour. Some apricot. Pretty decent for a sour.

Hazy orange-tan. Frothy, soft off-white head. Barnyard apricot. Outright lemon-apricot sourness. Tangy, super fluffy body. World Class all the way. One of the greatest Lambics. Wow. Orange, grapefruit...captures a huge range of citrus flavor. So superior to US sours it hurts.

750mL bottle, bottled 2008. Pours slightly hazy gold with a thin white ring of froth. Strong hint of acid in the aroma, a little fruit and only a slight funk. Tart! Some fruit as well. Light body, average carbonation and a bone dry finish. I must try a bottle without five years on it to see what might have gone missing.

UPDATED: NOV 16, 2013 From tap at moeder lambic fontainas. Pours hazy yellow, no head. Aroma is vinegar, tart, sour. Taste is tart, sour, slightly bitter with an excellent fruity apricot and citrus balance. This makes the beer very drinkable. Really cool apricot flavour.

2013 vintage sampled on 6th Nov 2013 at the brewery. Huge apricot and citrus nose with some funk. Taste is sour funk followed up by a huge rush from the fruit. Ends with a sustained dryness. Truly awe inspiring stuff. Best fruit lambic I've ever had.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text: Vintage 2013, pours a hazy orange color with a little off white head. Huge apricots, citrus and slight funk on the nose. Tastes of peaches, apricots, citrus with a nice acidic sour, funk balance through out and leaves a pleasant dry tart finish. Each sip leaves me wanting more. One of my top 5 beers Ive tasted to date.

75cl bottle. Hazy orange/yellow with medium head.
NOSE : strong aromas of fruits : apple, lemon, zest, pear and apricot of course. Lactic notes, tart aromas. 
SIP : medium bodied, fine carbonation with oily texture. The beer is quite dry with strong fruity background and distinctive yeast notes. Sour flavors are not overwhelming and sweeten with grains and apricot. It does remind an orange in the finish. Zesty dryness is well balanced and round. Aftertaste is acidic with fruits and wood aromas making the surface. 
OVERALL : it is one of the best I tasted from Cantillon. Its amazingly well balanced for a lambic and really complex. Nice one.

Pours a hazy dull gold with a small off-white head, The smell is apricot, funk, sour, mild malt sweetness. The taste is apricot, sharp sourness ending very dry with sharp bitterness and sourness. Light in body with active, sharp carbonation. A totally great beer.
Vintage 2013, fresh bottle. Orange hazy colour, some white foam. Overwhelming fruity aroma of apricots. Very well balanced. Sour and refreshing. Some sweetness. Light bitter aftertaste.

Nice sour fruit flavor. Really light colored head. Had it from a fresh bottle. Small hint of peaches mostly tart flavor from the barrels. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
UPDATED: DEC 17, 2013 Bomber - thanks Folty! Hazy murky golden yellow pour. White head. Big apricot aroma. Quite sour. Yeast is there. Prickly on the tongue. Sweet. This is awesome!

[18-OCT-2013] Draught at EurHop Beer Festival (EBF) 2013 in Rome. Hazy yellow to orange with a nice head, aroma of cheese, strawberry, apricot, brett, very refreshing, flavor is sour and refreshing with lemon, apricot, fun and clean, medium to full bodied, great

Bottle from walts cellar shared with some of his denver friends. You are missed brother.hazed yellow with a thin head. Tart nose with a sweaty scent. Oh yes, sour fruit flavor at first. Thin body. Flavor quenches and leaves me wanting more. Just love the acidity and citrus.

Bière ambrée/orange au col blanc mousseux qui retombe assez vite ; légère pétillance. Lambic hyper présent (normal on est chez Cantillon !) doù le goût un peu sûret mais compensé par la présence de labricot et surtout du goût du noyau dabricot. Prix dexcellence !

Orange trouble, pétillance légère, petit col blanc. Malt et lambic bien présents, légèrement sûre, fruitée mais pas trop, un rien herbacée et avec une belle amertume. Un peu sèche. Sont vraiment forts chez Cantillon!

Bottle: cloudy & rustic sunburst shade of amber with a foamy, white cap that sits generously at two fingers, big & bubbly, leaving a little lacing behind. Aroma is absolutely insane. Apricot, peach, apple skins, lemon flesh, barnyard funk, wet hay, damp cellar floor, mild cheesy finish... So damn funky & tart & fruity all at once, it was absolutely unlike anything Ive ever smelled before. The ripeness of the apricots & the harmony with the intense funk was amazing. The taste was equally as impressive. Ripe, juicy apricots, peaches, & various stone fruits, gushing with intense tartness and mild sweetness. Wet hay, old corks, forest floors, damp wood & barnyard funk all around the edges. Perfect amount of sharp acidity, tartness, fruit, funk, & everything else. This is the best beer Ive had to date & as close to perfection as Ive gotten.

Appearance: Hazy yellow color with a small white head.Aroma: A very pleasant mild apricot aroma.Palate: Medium + body. Dry and acidic. Average carbonation.Taste: Acidic apple, fruity, yeast and mild apricot.Overall impression: Not as much apricot in the flavor as expected. Lovely refreshing ale.Personal stats: Bottle shared with Simon at Schouskjelleren in Oslo, Norway.

A: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, White Head, Mild Lacing

S: Straw, Apricots, Musty

T: Apricots, Grassy, Sour Mash

M: Decent Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Bitter

Overall, pretty nice solid apricot sour beer

Pours a lighter gold with lots of bubbles and a small wispy head.

Smells like ripe peaches with some barnyard funk going on as well.

Very light and crisp taste. Lots of smooth peach flavors balanced nicely by the yeast. Finishes with a slight tartness. Fantastic.

Light bodied with higher carbonation levels.

Been wanting to get one of these for a while and was not disappointed. One of the better ones Ive had.

How: Draught.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Hazy orange colour with a minimal white head.
Aroma: Sour, apricot, fruit, stable.
Body: Medium body, almost no carbonation.
Flavour: Sour, acidic, apricot, tart, brett.
Comment: Compared to the other fruit lambics from Cantillon (or from anywhere really) this one stands out as one of the best. It is still a Cantillon and has the special Cantillon flavour that might not be for everyone. A really good beer if you are into the sour barnyard style, if not leave it to us who are.

2012 Vintage Poured into Cantillon Stemware at 45 degrees. 

A- Very hazy orange (apricot skin) with a white head about an eighth of an inch thick that doesnt seem to want to go away. Vigorous carbonation is evident, the bubbles seem to be rising to the surface at a champagne-like rate. No lacing is evident. 

S- Classic cantillon barnyard with a citrus acidity similar to orange zest. Apricots are very evident as well, providing a sweet, tropical note to the funky lactic overtones. 

T- I dont even know where to begin. Extremely complex. While the apricot is very mellow on the nose, it comes through with a huge tart stone fruit mixed with lemon zest and orange peel. Pretty much, Im trying to say it tastes like apricots without saying the word apricot. After the apricot flavor dies off, there is an earthy flavor that makes way for a huge blast of lemon zest and lactic acidity that leaves you looking like a sour patch kid. A good two minutes after a sip, I can still feel the tingly sensation you get in your face after downing a whole bag of sour skittles and then eating the dust in the bottom of the bag. For someone who used to eat lemons as a young child, this beer is a dream come true. 

M- Prickly carbonation with an extremely dry finish in addition to the extremely sour notes from the taste. I am literally sitting here sweating because of the level of puckering.

O- The aroma and flavor are absolutely the best part of this beer, which is nice since those are usually the two biggest factors in a beer for me. This one definitely looks great as well, but with the huge apricot aromas and the complex stone fruit flavors bouncing around with the brett funk and huge acid, the flavor and aroma are what make this a world-class beer. Im glad I got to down a whole bottle of this by myself instead of the half ounce pour I was lucky enough to have at a tasting earlier this year.

Pours yellow with a minimal head.

Smell is soft funky horse blanket, citrus and lemon

Taste is tart, fruity lemons and peaches (apricot), and belgian funk

Crisp and refreshingly sour

World class
On tap. Hazy orange with quickly dissipating white head. Aroma and taste is rich and fruity; lemon, melon, apricot, orange, oak, barnyard and acid.

UPDATED: OCT 15, 2016 On draught for Zwanze Day 2013 at Avenue Pub! Pours a hazy golden brown, little to no head or lacing. Aroma is sweet apricot notes up front, musky straw and wood in the middle, acetic sour ending. Taste follows, nice balance and smooth on the mouth. Not crazy and overpowering like some American stuff, amazing!

UPDATED: AUG 21, 2014 Zwanze Day 2013. Pours A bright orange. Aroma is a Nice sour. Taste is beautiful sharp sour acidic but not burning. Amazing. Finish is medium long amazing slightly salty. Mouthfeel is soft and awesome. 4.9

At Cantillon on he day it was bottled. Pours murky orange with zero carb. Aroma is absolutely massive authentic apricot / peach. Like I just cut into a piece of fruit. Taste is awesome funky greatness, apricot amazing. Very low acidity. Love love. One of the best beers I have ever had. 4.9
Bottle. Hazy golden color with a thin white head. Strong acidic aroma of apricot, apple and a used pee diaper. Strong acidic taste.
Bright and delightfully tart taste of fresh apricots. There is just a bit of funkiness ending with a little bitterness, probably from hops as the website says the apricots are pitted. Dry finish.
Bottle, peach tasting. Pours cloudy amber, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma is funk, Brett, fruity. Flavor is very light sweet, quite sour, light funk, fruity. Medium body

Bottle '11 - pours amber/ yellow hue and decent white head. Just a beautiful smell of apricots and some funk. Nicely balanced. The taste is apricots, tart, a little peppery and funky. Awesome!!!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: MAR 31, 2014 Blindprovas: skrapa på en bränd toast och samma ton finns i doften, samt funk. Bra drag i ättikan. Tung syra. Något av det suraste ever. När flaskan avslöjas kan man även ana aprikoser kan även bero på ökad temp möjligen. En 2005a på mikkeller & friends 2013. Johan ger oss ett glas var och jubel utbryter när glasens innehåll avslöjas. Tack Johan 

Drar ett glas på tap på Akkurat ca ett år gammal. Nu är aprikosen tydlig i både doft och smak. Syran är lägre. Tar ett glas till. Världsklass.


----- Färsk flarra (2013) i Bryssel med grabbarna. Tydlig aprikos i doft och smak. En av mina personliga favoriter från Cantillon.

Pours a hazy glowing orange color with quickly dissipating head. Nose is rich with notes of lemon candy, melon, oak, barnyard, fruit salad, and acid. The palate has a lot of fine carbonation, with flavors of lemon, oak, tart orange, a bit of sweet apricot, and of course sour and funk components. Dry, sour finish.
Bottle..pour is golden with a thin white head..Nose is apricot, funk, sugar, sweet..Taste is apricots, juicy fruits, sweetness, light tartness, dryness
My first Cantillon.. Love the aromatics; straw bale, barn floor and dried apricots. Taste is SOUR! Lots of acidity... will bring some cheese next time!

Bottled in 09.2009. Znakomity i bardzo wytrawny i cierpki lambick. Metny o zltym zabarwieniu, glebokim a po dolewce drozdzy z butelki jak zoltko jajka, wogole nieprzeswitujaca ciecz. Kwasowosc mocna i niektorych nowicjuszy moze przytloczyc. Troche przez te cierpkosc trudno sie degustowalo te spora butelke o,75cl. Ale klasa i klasyk zarazem. Aromat morelowo-brzoskwiniowy goruje nad innymi doznaniami. Polecam to kwasne piwo to elegandzkiego objadu w gronie rodziny.

Bottle shared at RBAG 2013. Hazy yellow body, timid white head. Aroma delivers a lovely distinct apricot note amongst the sour funk. The palate has that lovely yoghurty sourness and funky character with a subtle unripe apricot flavour. Like I found in Cascade The Vine, the fruit here is more apparent in the aroma and more integrated/hidden in the complexity of the palate. Beautiful.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: 2012 bottle shared by Tony at RBAG 2013, thanks man. Clear orange pour, aroma is sour beyond belief, hints of lemon and bits of orange/apricot. Taste is super sour and quite acidic. Enjoyed it though.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle, clear orange poru with fluffy white head, aroma brought notes of peach, apricot, nice oak, vanilla, hints of funk, nice jammy notes. Taste is a mix of peach, nice vanilla, oak, apricot, nice funk, earthy tones, more jammy apricot, finishing fairly tart, sweet, bitter. In the words of Aaron, "Fuck yeah"

UPDATED: MAY 4, 2015 Bottle - Fresh 2014 - Fresh fleshy white fruit.  Nice fruity, light sour, not as puckering fresh.  One of my favorite beers from Cantillon.  Vintage 2011 - Apricot, lemon, Bret and funk. Clear gold with a medium white head. Lemon and an acidic sourness but no distinct flavour.

750ml originally reviewed 11-11-09...2008 vintage.

Pours a light golden color with a white head. Half a fingers worth of head leaves some lacing along with a nice cap on top of the beer. Super tart/sour, funk, barynard notes, apricots, sweet fruit such as mangos and pears. A nice meld of funk and sweetness. Lots of the funk up front and a nice subtle sweetness on the finish. Much like the nose, only more sweet fruit notes by comparison. Sour/tart, funky barnyard, horse blanket, apricots, pears. Light and fizzy. Champagne-esk carbonation. Refreshing and gentle on the palate.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2013 75cl bottle. 1 year old (not properly cellared). Shared with Mathieu87.
APPEARANCE: light clouded blond beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: peaches, horse blanket.
TASTE: sweet, fruity but not really the peaches? Some sourness.
Very good beer, though deteriorated a little with bad cellaring.
Score adapted for a fresh sample!
Bottle at The drunk monk. Orange colour with small white head. Apricot, fruity and acidic aroma. Apricot, sweet and acidic taste. Also sour. Light body.

Bottle @ Søernes Ølbar. Pours unclear orange with a frothy small white head. Aroma is lactic, tart fruit, apricot, yeast and barnyard. Taste is light+ sweet and tart. Body is light+, texture is oily/light slick, carbonation is soft. Finishes dry and tart. Not that complex, just lovely to drink.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2013 Looks like apple juice urine. Aroma is subtle yet TART apricot bursting forth. Very effervescent mouthfeel, with taste being citric funk, tang, some acid, some apricot behind the sour and some peppery zing. Gets more fruity as it warms a little. Palate is lingering acid, mild apricot, and something kind of off. Overall, a great fruit lambic - a jolly good time, and a surprising drink.

Bottle 2005 from Mikkeler & Friends. Wow. Sour apricots on the nose. Taste is just insane. Sour apples, peach, apricot, slight sweetness but beautifully caught by the sourness underneath. Finish is incredible, taste just keeps going. Expensive, but definitely worth it.

Bottle thanks to Bruce.  Aroma is super complex with peaches, funky stilton, apricot and oak.  Pours a light peach color with a big quick fizzy head.  Taste is more subdued with good peach and oak flavors.  Not too tart.  Very enjoyable.  Could do with one of these every day.

A - Hazy golden-orange with a finger of frothy white head. Fades normal.

S - Apricot, sweet wheat, oak, vanilla, barnyard funky yeasts, tart green fruits, sourness, stone fruits, tart green fruits.

T - Sweet and tart apricots and other stone fruits, funky barnyard yeasts, tart green fruits, oak, vanilla, lemon zest, some light sourness.

M - Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Smooth with a tart, sour, funky finish.

D - Fantastic complexity and balance. The apricots are fantastic.

.75 bouteille. Hazy yellow. Dried apricots on nose, hay and a bit of barnyard. Ok, a bit soft aromatic, with rosy floralness. Body is dry and acidic. Sour apples, sour apricots (if theres such a thing), funk and hay. Mouth watering, long finish. A beer youll remember.-- bb/h(n9)

Had a bottle of this at Mikkeller bar. 2012 vintage. Nice amount of funk blended with fresh apricots. Cantillon classic taste is there. Lovely! (Short review due to the massive amounts of beer I drank during the CBC13.)

UPDATED: APR 30, 2014 Bottle 75 cl. Pours cider lemon like with not much head and a great fruity scent. Nice peach sour and bitter taste. Great sour taste makes this an great alternative to other beer, the lambic beers does not disappoint. Kind of a straightforward taste tho. Not as much complexity as i expected. But the peach taste is great.

Draft at Mikkeller & Friends. Cloudy orange amber with a medium, white head quickly diminishing. Tart cidery nose with leathery dried fruit notes. Bone dry vineous vinegar flavor. Wood. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body, tart finish. Abricots hard to detect.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Pours hazy peach with a low white head. Aromas of peach, green apples, green grapes, funk, citrus, oak. Taste is very fruity with farmhouse funky notes and lovely earthy notes.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied and somewhat dry with with moderate carbonation.

UPDATED: MAR 11, 2017 Pours foggy amber with low white head
Sour Aromas of peach, apricot, 
Exploding mouthfeel of sour fruits with a great subtle but still nice ending
Very well balanced and simply great

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap. Pours murky amber with basically no head. Aroma of green grapes, apples, grass, and actually light cherry. Taste is very balanced sour with tons of green apples. Body is light, quite refreshing with average carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a light orange colour with a big white head. Aroma of apricot, grass and green apples. Flavour is awesome! Very sour, with apricot and greenapples. Doesnt get too sour though, its a quite good carbonation, which makes it more refreshing and brings the best out of the sourness. Palate is almost a bit fizzy, with a good,medium body. Very good sourbeer indeed.

UPDATED: APR 21, 2013 Pours a cloudy light orange with little white head and a very minimal lacing. Aroma of fresh apricots, lots of funk, sourness is present on the nose, oak tannins. Taste starts with apricots, sourness is very present with funk, light vinous, very tart. Low body and medium carbonation. Very fresh. My least favorite fruit lambic from cantilllon.

Bottle. Pours hazy orange with a big white head, high carbonation level. Aroma is funky, dried apricots, fruit and some vinegar. Taste is fresh, fruity sour, rhubarb with some light sweetness from the apricot, short lived aftertaste, even though a great sour imo.
A fantastically balanced lambic.  The apricot is slight yet present.  The bitterness is dry and not astringent.

Bouteille 750mL (embouteillée en 2012). Blonde trouble avec une bonne mousse. Nez moyen de confiture dabricots. Bouche où le côté acétique du lambic est présent mais atténué par une fraîcheur acide dabricots. Très bonne.

750ml bottle from last year. Pours a pale orange with white head. Aroma is light on the distinctive wild notes but fruity apricot plus white grape notes come through nicely. A bit of a let-down here though. Taste-wise this is gorgeously fruity to begin with and progressively wilder as the bottle empties. As ever superbly balanced and refined. The last Cantillon I had was at the 7 year mark whereas this is barely 7 months, and the differences are really apparent. I think the sweet spot is probably somewhere in the middle. Id like to try this again with more age: long enough for the wild side to come through more but before the fruit fades away.

Bottle, many thanks to Pallieter85. Bottled 2011. Hazy orange color with huge quickly disappearing white head.  Aroma of apricots, funk, barnyard, some sourness. Very tart taste with apricot, lemon, peaches, oak, earthy notes. Long tart finish. Great.

peachy apricot funky aroma, poured from a 2011 bottle, champagne like palette, light aftertaste with plenty of flavor

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with Damico at Torst.  Pours a pale orange yellow color with white foam head.  Aroma of peach, funk, and slight vinegar.  Has a sweet tart taste with gentle notes of peaches and perfect foamy mouthfeel.  Great body for the style.
Pours a cloudy orange with white lacing. Huge burst of apricot. Somewhat sour, but pleasantly sweet at times. Incredible

Bottle (2012) at the brewery, making a rare beer even rarer. Hah. Damn shame I had noone with me to split it with but hey. Poured a misty golden body, still holding some carbonation. Lovely apricot jam nose with some funky undertones. I could smell this all day! Fresh, sour taste with fine apricot undertones. Definitely another great lambic.

UPDATED: AUG 5, 2016 Tap, 2011 version. Unclear orange with a medium sized good lasting white head. Aroma is apricot, not unlike the apricot soda I drank at my colleague Peters reception yesterday. He is retiring after a long career in IT. Also light hay, tart, barnyard. Taste is light+ sweet and medium sour. Much better than the soda. Light+ body, oily texture, nice prickling carbonation. Tart and medium dry finish. I hope there will be foufoune instead of soda pop when I retire.


Edit: After trying a couple of fresher bottles, this goes up from 4 to 4.5.

Bottle from Mane Liquor. Pours golden orange with a small, firm white head. Lasts for the duration, not much lacing left. Nose is spot on dried apricots. The sourness lets you know its there but gets overrun by some sweetness. It really does smell amazing. Taste unfortunately lets it down. Dried apricot, loads of bitterness. Very sweet and sour. A bit of a mish mash to be honest. Maybe my expectations were too high. Either way its solid but a little disappointing

08-MAR-2013, bottle @Sonni, @Ulkløbben tasting, 2012 vintage from Ølbutikken.
Hazy orange/golden with lasting off-white head.
Wonderfull peach and tart aroma.
Taste is peach, funk, leather. Still young and very peach centered.
Quite sour with lively carbonation makes it very fresh despite the huge fruit sweetness.
Fantastic. Hugs to Sonni:)

Bottle shared with UDBeernut months ago.  Rating scribblings found in a vertical pile of hoo hah.  Upward sourness with a strong base of apricot and pear.  Warming.  A hazy, even , yellow must.  Ephemeral body.  Thanks to the azz kissing bottle fairy.

UPDATED: NOV 17, 2015 Biondo carico ed effervescente con un velo di schiuma bianca. Aroma con forti sentori di albicocca che ammorbidiscono la controparte acetica; gusto acidulo, dolciastro e fruttato, splendido equilibrio complessivo. Corpo e struttura alleggeriti dalleffervescenza vivace, come ogni capolavoro di Cantillon. Impossibile non innamorarsi di queste birre!
This is now one of my new favorites! Finally had the opportunity to try it (on tap nonetheless) and it lived up to the billing!! Just an amazing lambic!!!

2011 and a 2012 bottle had side by side at Cantillon.  The pour is hazy golden orange with a small white head on in both years.  The nose is where the difference is.  The 2011 had a big apricot, peaches, lemon, vinegar, leather and funk.  The fresh one had less fruit in the for of peach and apricot, more earthy bitter nose.  The taste was not even comparable the one with a year and change was amazing, super balanced sweet and sour.  The fresh one had more bitter to it.  The mouthfeel of both was soft and smooth, medium body and a long finish.  Lesson learned here, give your fou foune a little age!
750ml pours a hazy orange with off white head that sticks around the entire drink. Strong apricot and wood aroma. Tart apricot with a musty taste very sour finish.
Yellow orange in color... Aroma of apricot and tartness, flavor is amazingly sour and tart of apricots and acidity... Lingers for what seems like forever... I love this brewery

750 ml bottle. Pours a murky yellow with medium head. Aromas of citrus, peach, mint, and sour malt. Flavor of sour tangy fruit (including lemons, apricots, and apples) and light toasted malt, Sour but delicate. Wow.

UPDATED: SEP 28, 2014 
Tap @ Pikkulintu.
Rated on 20140920.
Aroma is  surprisingly sweet and fruity, apricot is very dominant on the aroma. Very sour palate, apricot and gooseberries on the flavor. Very tasty. 
75 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100212.
Pours hazy yellow color with a small head. Aroma of peach, apricot, some lemony notes and grass. Flavor of hay, apricot, peach, some sugar and toffee. Mild sourish palate. Very nice.
4366
Zztv, Oranje, niet helder, ruikt echt lekker, abrikoos, perzik. Smaakt beetje zuur, muf, zoet.

Hazy peach-y with a clean white head that wants out. Aroma is sourness, slight fruit (I wouldnt say that it is apricots) and a general citrusy feeling. Swirling the glass easily revives a creamy head that leaves some nice lacings. Taste is medium sour with a refreshing acidity. Some apricot flavors do show up and even more as it warms up (HINT: drink it close to room temperature, my cold room is just too cold during the winter months and I started drinking at maybe 8-10C and it is just too cold). I swear that I get a nice apricot skin mouthfeel/flavors now and even some pits. A really fun fruit lambic, one that grows on you as you drink. Im @ 4.1 right now but I might have to edit this rating before I reach the bottom of this bottle. Yum!

The appearance shows high carbonation. Thin lacing on an orange colour.
Aroma has heavy funk, high acidity, citrus. You can actually smell the apricot.
Dry mouthfeel and a lot of carbonation.
The taste is also realy funky with citrus and the apricot peaking through.
Does not meet my expectations, probably because of all the hype.

(75 cl bottle from Ølbutikken; 2012 Vintage) Pours a cloudy amber with medium, white head that diminishes quickly. Some regeneration and a little lace. Aroma is cidery with leather and fruit notes. Oily texture, soft carbonation, medium body and a tart finish. Flavour is bone dry and tart. Not as fruity as I would have expected for such a fresh vintage. Girlfriend says: "I dont see why its one of the best beers. Its like cider to me."

The best sour Ive had for sure! Cant imagine how they can outdo this with the Blåbær Lambic, but then again, maybe I can.
This is a really sour beer, the acid sort of attacks your tounge, but when youve had your first and second sip you surrender to the corrosive feel and go all in for the sweet, sweet apricots, clementine and champagne. The aftertaste is amazingly fresh, while the tarty yeast makes its way with an almost olive like slight bitterness. I must admit that I recently fell in love with this beer style, so I might be going a little high on this rating, but Id rather go high now than never go anywhere.
funky apricot aroma, fruity tart flavour with a lingering tart finish. Very impressive beer - possibly my favourite Cantillon beer to date.

Huge apricot aroma when you remove the cork. Smell is juicy apricot, lemon, clementine, very slight funk. Flavor is tart, apricot is well-balanced. Just another awesome cantillon beer that is refreshing, drinkable, but full of flavor.
Draft at VSK night at Blint Tiger back on 11/28/2013 with James, Streets, some others. Light, hazy yellow pour. Tart but not acidic or salivating. Peachy sort of fruit flavor. Really good.
Bottle. Hazy golden with white head. Apricot and funk aroma, dusty. Taste has apricot up front follwed by typical lambic funk. Very tart. Delish

bottle at home .... golden amber ... thin white head ... softfunky fruits.... huge apricot and raspberry  nose... huge huge funk up front ... light tartness ... and then just blah ... musty funk finish

750mL bottle dated AUG 28 2012, pours a hay golden/peach with a medium white head. Aroma is mellow and sweet, lots of sweet apricot , some light funk and yeast, damn I wish they made a perfume like this, I would be all over that lady. Taste of sweet apricot, hay, tart, with some sour funk, dry lively carbonation. I wish I could have one of these everyday! Glad I decided to open this one sooner than later.

Bottle shared by atom.  Hazy, orange apricot color.  Not the prettiest lambic.  A good amount of apricot present in the aroma.  Tart, slight bile character, maybe a it of moldy cheese.  Wow.  This may be my favorite fruit lambic.  Loads of apricot flavor, slight acidity towards the finish.  I love the balance and the big apricot flavor.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2013 I first drank this beer at the Cantillon Brewery in 2002 while in Brussels. It was outstanding and a highlight of the beers I drank on that trip.  My second tasting was a 2011 75cl bottle at Torst shared with the RB crew in March 2012.  This tasting confirmed Fou Foune as one of my favorite beers ever.  A beautiful fruit lambic.  Pours cloudy apricot colored amber with a medium white head.  Aroma is funky, sweet and tart with amazing apricot notes.  The taste is beautiful; a perfect balance between sweetness and acidity with huge apricot and peach notes and great funkiness and tartness. This beer is complex but simple and simply terrific.

Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena/oranssina ja sameana, vaahto on keskikokoinen ja katoava. Haju on makean aprikoosinen, lambicmaisen hapan, lehtinen ja multainen. Maku on happaman aprikoosinen, marjainen, lehtinen, multainen ja hiivainen. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen ja melko täyteläinen. Kokonaisuutena tämä on todella kesäinen tuotos ja odotetun aprikoosinen, jossa kuitenkin särmää.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2014 Bottle (750 ml) 2012. Whole bottle by myself! Hazy golden/peaches color with a medium white head that doesnt stay long. Aroma is full of apricots with lots of barnyard, funky notes and a slight peach presence. Taste is extremely tart for the first few sips, but it then become "just" heavily tart. Apricots and peach again here, funky notes, horse blanket, barnyard... the Cantillon signature is everywhere in this one. Mouthfeel is tart and extremely dry, astringent. This is an hardcore fruit lambic! One of the best Cantillon Ive drank so far along with St-Lamvinus and Blabaer. 9-4-9-4-17 = 4.3

Bottle (750 ml) @ Cantillon and on tap @ Moeder Lambic Fontainas. Both 2013 vintage. Pour hazy bright peach colour with a small white head head little lacing. Aroma is astonishing... bright and intense apricot presence balanced by just the right amount of Cantillon funk (less lemony than in the other beers too). Taste is also a great marriage between the massive apricots presence and the nice funk of Cantillon lambic. Moderate tartness. Medium body, Just the right amount of carbonation. Moderately dry finish. This is pure awesomeness. Its not the most complex beer, but the balance between the bright fruitiness from the apricots and the funk from Cantillon lambic is amazing. A great beer. 10-4-9-4-18 = 4.5
Bottled 75cl. Horse blanket throughout. Complex. Apricot most present in the finish. Some dandelion sneaking in late. Delicious.

Bottle at blind tiger. Pour is cloudy yellow, dissipating light head and light lacing. Aroma is funk, apricot, lemon rind, sour oak. Taste is sour apricot, sweet tart. Light carbonation. Medium body, long sour finish. Overall amazing sour fruit lambic. All night baby.
750 bottle. 2012 bottling. Pours really nice then carbonation settles. Apricot, some peach, and tart apple. Pretty dry, but maybe with time will get even drier. Really nice.

750ml bottle shared by brew3crew. Great apricot and peach nose. Half hazy, peachy orange color. Awesome peachy tangy apricot skin taste. Minimal white head. Medium / light body. Good light soft crisp carbonation. Great long tasty tangy apricot aftertaste. Delicious for sure.

UPDATED: FEB 26, 2014 From a 75 cl bottle shared at Meridian Pint, DC.  Pours cloudy dark gold with an off white head.  Sour apricot in the nose.  Very astringent mouthfeel.  Lots of apricot and tart apple.  Crisp sour finish.  Nice.

On draft at Churchkey DC during Sour Session number 9.  Pours a clear brownish amber with a feint off white head.  Otherwise, as from with the bottled version.  Lovely and refreshing beer.

75cl bottle (2012). Pours hazy orange with thin bubbly white head; looks the part. Aroma is a beautiful mix of lemon rind, yeast funk, old leather, delicate apricot. Taste has all the tart citric sourness you'd expect from the style, plenty of lemon rind, lemon juice, funk notes; as all of that subsides, there's a rising, delicate juicy apricot flavour that engulfs the palate. Amazingly well balanced. Bone dry finish. An exceptional brew.

Bottle at Cafe Rose Red. Orange hazy colour, off white colour. Quite spritzy, as you would expect, lovely texture. Aroma is peach sourness, very simple but lovely. Taste is lovely, peach, sourness, initial lemon hit, once again, not massively varied, but beautiful. Extremely drinkable. Initial tartness, but afterwards fading peach. Great.

UPDATED: DEC 31, 2014 750ml bottle. Cloudy orangey amber colour with average, frothy, fairly lasting and lacing, white head. Moderately sourish and fruity aroma, a pure apricot bath. Taste is wonderfully balanced, fruitiness, tartness, and sweetness match perfectly, well supporting carbonation. Excellent.

750ml bottle. Cant believe I have not rated this...cloudy amberish/orange color with a small sized head. Apricots, some funkiness, fruity, earthy, and light citrus. Im not a huge apricot fan, but this one I did not mind.

Bottle from BrewDog Birmingham; hazy golden amber pour, creamy white head, tart aroma, taste is sour but not lip puckering sour hit you get with some Lambics, the sour is balanced with a sugary taste, this is a really good lambic.

2012 vintage

More of a hazy orange color. I suppose more of an apricot color, not really  peach. Works though. Good layer of film on the beer. Just bits of lacing. 

On opening got big barnyard funk notes once settled down got bright and vibrant apricot notes with backing funk. Good stuff. 

Apricot taste with the peach fuzz to boot. Nice. Bright and vibrant sourness that really mix well. Slight notes of vinegar, straw, apple and pear more than apricot in the mouth. Crisp and light in the mouth. Lingering sourness and just fun to drink.
Il lambic di cantillon alle albicocche è indimenticabile! Star di Birre sotto lalbero!
On draft at Zwanze Day 12 Chicago. Stupid good, funk frenzy with love on the side, perfectly tart and earthy with the refreshing characteristics of the best lambics ever.

Bottle on the train to Edinburgh (9am breakfast beer) from the brewery - 08/12/12. 2012 vintage.
Murky light orange in appearance, akin to pineapple juice. Thin slightly off white head that clears to a film and the edge.
Nose is sweet and tarte apricot, light wood, some sugar, touch of sherbet.
Taste comprises apricot, sweet sugar, tarte apricot, light mustyness, not over tarte - spot on !
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, light sour/tarte finish.
Excellent  and some of my 5 a day :P
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: On tap at Patricks pub . Pours cloudy golden with an off-white head. Aroma of peach, sour notes, cellar notes, some leather and barnyard. Flavor is sour and sweet with peach,  grapes,  wheat and barnyard leading to a dry finish. Medium body, average carbonation.
on tap @RLRL-white ring-hazy yellow.  A-sour fruit-apricot, wood.  T-funk/yeast, lt malt, sour fruit-apricot, wood.

Aroma: strong tart fruit, leather and funk, apricot.  Pours a slightly hazy light orange color, fizzy white head that quickly dissipates to a ring.  Flavor is well balanced between sourness, fruit, and funk.  Lots of apricot, some citrus, peach, fairly high sourness, low-medium level of earthy funk.  Light body, high carbonation, very crisp and dry.  Nice brew - happy to have had the opportunity to try it.

Bottle from Belgianbeershop.com. A hazy orange golden beer with a moderate white head. The aroma is very fruity, filled with peach and apricots and a clear sourness. The taste is very well balanced and very fruity. This is a wonderful lambic, near to perfection and a must drink for every lambic lover.

august 2012 bottle shared with friends at ddc white waiting for my zwanze. hazy golden-orange with a nice white head, good retention and lacing. funky peaches and apricots, very fresh, light oxidation, hint of sweetness, lactose-like feeling, present but delicate sourness. great balance between light sweetness and acidity. prickly carbonation without it being aggressive, light body, very nice citrusy-lightly acidic finish. best lambic to date. high rating? nah, this is so close to perfection.
Draft for Zwanze Day. Hazy peach slice appearance. Nose is apricot, perspiration, gym socks. Taste is tart apricot, some other light fruits like peach, some funk, sweat.
UPDATED: JAN 6, 2013 Amber-orange color. Sour and apricot aroma, also sour at taste with good apricot flavour.

Wow, this one was incredible. Tap at Redlight Redlight. Aroma is huge peach and apricot with a touch of citrus. Light funk aroma to balance it out. Wow the aroma is so strong and in your face with peach/apricot. Pour is a hazy, light orange color with some fizzy bubbles for lacing. Taste is strong peach and apricot with a very balanced sweet-to-funk ratio. The funkiness is a bit more subdued in this brew than in some other Cantillons that I tried on the same night. Very good brew.

UPDATED: JAN 11, 2013 Bottle 750ml, Shared with friends :) [Bottled August 2012]
Pours hazy golden. Aroma is of peaches, apricots, funk. Taste is of peaches, apricots, sligth sourness. Overall: This is certainly the best cantillon I had so far. I almost got thrown down my chair, but the place was too crowded so I was safe. I lack the words to describe the experience, but this lambic is very good: Incredible freshness of the fruits, perfect balance, not too acidic, nor sour. This is certainly one I will be looking for in the future, with a vultures eye.

On draft at West Lakeview for Zwanze Day 2012.  Pours a cloudy yellow amber color with a white head.  Aroma is big apricot and some light funk.  Medium on the palate with soft carbonation.  Flavor is sour, apricot, funky, a little yeasty.  Absolutely delicious. The highlight of the day for me.

on tap at the holy grale for zwanze day, this is insane, smell of semi sweet apricot and then the funk comes through ever so lightly. appearance of cloudy orange with a ring of white bubbles that stayed through the whole glass. the apricot comes through perfectly, not overwhelming at all, then the sour starts to creep in and makes you smile again. palate is bubbly . overall this is a steal and exciting beer that any sour lover should try.

Draft at Redlight. Hazy deep gold pour with a small white head. Aroma has tons of apricot fruitiness, yeasty funkiness, lemons, sour dough, and more citrus. Huge apricot on the front fading into tart lemon peels and citrus, layered barrel and yeasty funk with a tart finish with more apricot. Extremely complex and fantastic beer. Refined carbonation and medium bodied. I would drink this daily if I could.

On tap at the Barrel Cellar at Zwanze Day 2012. Pour is hazy peach with a small white head that quickly dissipated. Aroma is so bright and fresh; ripe peaches, apricots, green apples, light oak, and pear, but the peaches are just beautiful. Taste is bright peach juice, apricots, tangerines, orange juice, light citrus, a touch of wax, and cheese with a light sour finish. Medium mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Seriously tasty shit. Fresh squeezed apricot juice with beautifully balanced tartness. Awesome!!

On tap at Hop and Vine

A: Golden-orange with a thin lacing.

N: Apricot, lemon, some sourness. Not as complex as I might have expected.

T: Tons and tons of apricots. Lemon rind and some raspberry hints. More apricot. Peach. A very pleasant sourness some glue funkiness.

M: Dry and somewhat oily. Good without being perfect.

O: The fruit is spectacular here, but its not quite as complex as I would have hoped. Still a worthy beer, though.

Pretty much the reason i decided to face the crowds at Blind tigers VSK day this past wednesday.  Pours cloudy orange gold with tropical fruit and funky tart nose.  The apricot is more subtle than i thought but quite nice, you also get brett, oaky woodiness, barnyard, vanilla, and tart candy.  very dry on palate and quite refreshing.

On tap at Blind Tiger for VSK.  Ive never had Fou this fresh before.  Aroma is split equally between the sensation of cutting into a fresh apricot and sniffing a really dry, salty cheese.  Heaven for the senses!

As with most Cantillon fruit sours, the tartness is relatively mild when its fresh.  The fruit flavors here are hearty yet still delicate.  Minimal funkiness, just tart and delicious.  Easily the best off-the-shelf, fresh Cantillon lambic.  Wish I could drink Fou all day, every day. :(

Bottle from mi-orge, mi-houblon. Orange-blonde hazy with a thin white head, good lace. Nose gueuzey, massive sourness, touch of sweetness, dried apricot, tiny bit of icing sugar, fresh woody funk. Mouth sour freshness, apricot freshness, gentle lemony undertones. Fresh apricot lasts through to a sour, moderately dry end. Symphonic. 

Ive tried Fou Foune a couple of times, but never rated. I swear this is the best batch Ive ever tasted.

Serving: 750 ml. bottle from Papsoe.  Thanks Henrik!  It pours a cloudy orange color with a short lived head.  The nose has some funky barnyard notes along with a very light fruity note.  The flavor is classic Cantillon with lots of musty barnyard funkiness paired with a tangy peach/apricot note.  Tart but not overly so.  Just right in my mind.  Light in body with high carbonation.  Great brew.

Fresh bottle (8/12) was really nowhere near as acidic as I thought it would be.  Still plenty of really juicy, acidic stone fruit.  Sweet apricots and peaches wrapped in a mildly sour, acidic blanket.  Really well balanced.  Delicious, but hardly worth the cost or effort.

Bottled 8/2011
Pours a deep clear golden color with a huge white head that slowly dissipates but remains a cap on the top. The aroma is quite tart with lemons and sour apricots dominating the nose. A solid hit of funk and light plastic phenol round out the nose. The flavor is fruity with apricots with a lemony tartness and hints of sour cherries and plums. A solid hit of horsey funk round out the flavor nicely. Medium body with a moderate level of carbonation and a tart puckering mouthfeel. I think Im going to go against the grain on this one a little bit here. This is a fine beer and I enjoyed it, but I cant see what all the hype is behind this one.

Cask @ Akkurat.

This is a great brew by Cantillon. Smooth and gentle. Would love to see it age.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2012 Bottle @ Armins bachelor party. Thanks Armin! This was the 2009 vintage, I believe. Pours a fairly bright, cloudy yellow orange appearance with a white head. Somewhat juicy, stone fruit/apricot/peach fruity, light vanilla, a touch woody, very sour, mild barnyard aroma. The flavor was tasty but was so overly acidic that it was a bit hard for me to enjoy. Tons of peaches and apricots but they werent as apparent as I would have liked due to the huge acidity. There was some funk and barnyard underneath, but again, it really just seemed a bit too much for my taste. That being said, I really would love to try this again and preferably fresh. (3.9)
Tap @ Crooked Stave for Zwanze Day 2012. Holy shit, the fruits are super bright in this one, both in the nose and in the flavor. None of that burning acidity that I got with the 2009 bottle that we recently opened at Armins bachelor party. I fucking loved it. (4.4)
Bottle 75 cl. Pours cloudy dark orange with a whitish head. Apricots, funk, barnyard and light tones of sourness in aroma. Barnyard, apricots and light sourness and some earthy tones in taste.
I love this lambic, Perfect apricot hints with the brett character. velvet mouthfeel and balanced sweet and sour end.

Review #300

Had on tap at Local Option during their Occupy the Local Option. Served in a mini-snifter.

A: Pours a hazy golden color with dreamsicle like hues intertwined. The head is bubbly, airy and bone white in color. It recedes to a thick collar and leaves some splotchy lace.

S: Musty, earthy and funky in nature. There is a light apricot tartness and some under ripe apple skin as well. 

T: Subtle apricot flesh with a funky, barnyard like flavor. There is a mild tartness that is coupled with an oak and vanilla like sweetness on the finish.

M: Creamy up front with a drying, tannic finish. Spritzy carbonaton and a light body makes for a nice drinking brew.

O: The flavors seemed slightly muted overall and it didnt wow me like I thought it would. It was still an above average lambic, but I expected more fruity flesh and a little more tartness.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 02-20-2012
Excellent Lambic with hint of apricots that lend some sweetness to the acidic sourness. Perfectly balance, nice thin white head that lasts. lacing is nice with legs. Just a perfectly made lambic.

UPDATED: MAY 5, 2014 This apricot-filled beer has many a time has passed my mouth and throat. When the beer is fresh so it has amazing aromas of apricot and it recurs in taste. Meanwhile, the ever-present Cantillon taste is there.

when you have aged this beer, it seems to me as if all the lovely fruit flavor and aroma turns into acid. When I have drunk Fou foune 2005 and similar age, I have come across this acidity, I have not enjoyed even half of the beer as much as I would have done if it was fresh

Pours a nice golden honey color with a thin white head.  Aroma has nice tartness and soft apricot.  Flavor is very tart...near lemony...soft smooth apricot creeps in to cut the tartness without adding sweetness.  Nice light lively mouthfeel with a slightly acidic apricot finish.  Fabulous.
Glowing orange, light haze, no real head. Rounded funk, apricot and earthy. Very nice well developed medium sourness. Very tasty, smooth and rich. Nice! (At ZZT V)

Poured from a bottle thanks to nightfall. Youre awesome! Pours a hazy gold with a white head of foam with good retention. The aroma is heavily tart with some definitive fruity aspects. Taste is fairly sour. Mouthfeel is thick and a little chewy. This beer kicks ass. I love it.

Refrigerated bottle thanks to JStax poured into a tulip.  Pour opaque orange with small white head.  Thin small bubble lacing, medium body, well carbonated, and apricot aroma.  Taste is sour complex apricot and some oak.  One of the best fruit beers I have had.
2012.10.06 - sample at brewery (brouwkwintessens Cantillon) - apricot, but not overbearing, dry in the end

Man what a beauty!! Pours light orange with an initial huge foamy head that rapidly goes to just a slight ring. No visible lacing. Nose is barnyard, yeast and sour candies with maybe a hint of peach or apricot. Aromas are sour, some funkyness, light apricot, yeast. Taste is big sour, but just right. Some minor sweetness in the background. Lively carbonation and light ish body in the mouth. Incredible beer.

Purchased today at Bier Tempel in Brussels. Very fresh bottle dated August 28th 2012. Holy freshness! As expected, aroma is apricoty and funky. Very pleasant. Taste is a mix of barnyard, apricot, citric acid, funk and awesome. Crisp, smooth, medium carbonation with medium body. This is a beautiful beer. Deep hazy orange with a big fluffy snow white head. I love this beer! One of my favorite Cantillons.

2011 vintage, hazy Orange, great carbonation, this particular bottle was lacking on the smell, may have escaped from a damaged cork.  Regardless, the taste was very sour apricot, sweet vinegar and I had no problem drinking the entire bottle while having thoughts of cracking open another!  One of my fab beers ever

Really good....like a gueuze with some mild apricot...pours cloudy dirty yellow with white head.  Lots of lacing, minimal carbonation.  Tart and funky nose that gives way to a very tart yet balanced palate and a dry sour finish.  Very strong lambic.

UPDATED: OCT 25, 2012 Bottle from 2005 drank with friends in Mikkeller Bar in May 2012. Pours hazy gold with a fine, white foam head. Hugely tart, grassy aroma, with a bit of lemony fruits, fine apricot. Super tart flavor - I can literally feel the blisters forming on my tongue. Crazy lip-puckering sourness, some lemon, apricot, vinegar. Highly acidic. Light to medium bodied with fine, fizzy carbonation. Goosebump-inducing sour finish, some tart apricot. Pretty intense sourness here. Great stuff. (4.4)Bottle at THE Sour and Saison Tasting Post-Tasting, London. Thanks to Bruce for keeping the party going. Its a young bottle (a few months old) so nice to compare against my previous sample. Pours cloudy gold with a fine, white cream head. Good, tart fruit nose, some lactic notes, hints of sugary apricots. Great flavor, big and tart with restrained sugars, mellow apricot, slight lactic acidity. Light to medium in body with average carbonation. Tart finish with fruit sugars. Great stuff, though at this juncture I favor the older bottle. (4.2)

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 Oh sweet Jesus. Bubblegum, apricot , candy. Just vivid. Unlike anything Ive smelled before. Murky unfiltered  gold. Unassuming. Puckering sour apricot, slight vinous wood, sweetness after the swallow. Just an amazing beer, but yoi already knew.....

Rating #1500! Bottle shared at the September 2012 Santa Cruz tasting. Pours cloudy orange with an off-white head. Aromas of juicy fresh apricots with vinous grapey chardonnay accents. Tart apricot flavor, very vivid and fruity and fresh, lemonhead candy, damp oak, pixie stix. Words cannot describe. Soooooooo good.

UPDATED: NOV 4, 2015 Bottle shared at Moeder Lambic.  Pours cloudy yellow with a small white head.  Aroma is massive funky apricots and horse blanket.  Flavour is heavy sour, very tart with a little balancing sweetness.
pours a light hazy gold, no head.  Aroma of vinegar, light funk and apricots.  Taste follows sour with a hint of apricots.  Amazing, my favorite cantillon so far!
Bottle with Chris and Jay.  Courtesy of Chris last trip to the brewery.  A little funky, pungent apricots.  Sour with a lemon, vinegar, sweet apricots.  Smooth finish.  Delicious.

Bottle cork dated 2011 and on the label bottled August 25 2011, almost a year ago to the day. Big thanks to the trader that sent this one my way! Cork opened without much pop and it poured a bright yellow golden in color with a nice one finger white head and a steady stream of hefty carbonation. Aroma has nice punchy apricot, apricot skins, mild acidity, mild sweet tropical punches, and some yeast. It really draws you in with the complexity. Mouth feel is light and the carbonation medium and it has held up well under the ridiculous amount of swirling and smelling done to it. Flavor is much bigger on the acidity than anticipated and has big pucker factor to go with it. The fruit is still intact and battles back with some countering sweetness, bitter skins, and citrus rind. Really a battle of flavors that are right at the perfect place in time to be able to see the fresh fruited juiciness and the hefty sour side. Both are well received by me!

Brought this out for Jays bachelor party. Congrats Jay and Patty!  Pours a hazy faint orange in color with a small amount of tight white head. The nose is perfection....the pinnacle of what every beer should smell like. Its like apricot purée, apricot jam, and fresh apricot skin all shoved into one glass. Its bliss. The flavor is a balance of apricot, lemon, oak, and funk. Its incredibly sour, but not yet bracing. I much prefer fresh Fou Foune to aged bottles because of the balance sour and apricot. Mouthfeel is light, its acidic, gentle carbonation, and a long, pleasant finish. Im hard pressed to think of many beers that surpass Fou Foune in quality. It is one of the best fruit lambic from probably the best brewery in the world. I need like 70 more bottles of this.

UPDATED: DEC 4, 2012 had this back when i just begun srinking beer. remember totaly not loving it ( it was sour .. )

now im more used to drinking good beers, and sours, time to rerate this ( 3,1 was kinda irrelevant, sorry for that) 
so this is about this years fou foune, wich i had multiple times. yeah, i DO love it now. its sweet, yet sour. perfectly balanced. never been ( or will be) a fan of fruits and / or vegetables in real life, but hell, this is good ! cant believe how drinkable this is ! as a not-sour-fan ( how much longer can i still call myself after all those great sours i drank? ) i could drink a whole bottle by myself. my favourite cantillon so far, period, no discution. damn what a beer .

750mL bottle, courtesy of gramity (thanks Graham), pours a dirty, murky orangey yellow with a medium white head. Aroma has shitloads of funk, jelly  beans, light apricots, more funk, low sourness and low acidity - delightful nose. Flavour is exceedingly funky, with lots of yeast, barnyard funk, muted apricots, very low acidity and quite low sourness for a lambic - the funk dominates this one. Highly drinkable and complex. Excellent.

bottled April 2011. after having this batch twice in January at Avenue Pub in New Orleans, I decide to get around to a proper rating since I cant remember my previous one well enough.

early pour: lightly hazed golden body with a small film of a white head, quickly dying with no lasting retention.  first smell is some sort of strange calcium, dried fruit and concerte must.  the calcium, its almost like carbonic acid, smelling like an apricot-flavored soda, tingling and prickling the nose.  the fruit character is certainly apricot, though its partially muted and obscured by the yeast, which is lactic and brett-heavy in character, but also showing signs of butryic acid.  to be honest, the smell of the first pour lacks depth and comes across as apricot soda.  medium-full body with pronounced chewiness but high dryness gives it a syrupy / oily texture. lactic acid is sharp and brett seems to contribute small amounts of must and plastic. the finish, while quenching and salivating from the acid, leaves an oily film of soured apricot juice.  carbonation froth across the back is as magical as any Cantillon, though, and for me seems to be the high point of this beer.

late pour: some lemon rind pastry flavors start appearing, and the lactic acid seems to amplify, griping the entire mouth.  the oiliness is present more, and the dry apcicot flavor in the finish combined with the quenching acid is ridiculously enjoyable.  alas, the nose seems to move away from the apricot and show more of the lactic acid and calcium than before, but overall it doesnt change much between early and late pours as most other Cantillons.  its certainly a delicious lambic, and interesting to see the microflora play with the apricots, but I find myself preferring the more rich and pulpy raspberries in the Rose and pittiness of the cherries in Lou Pepe Kriek more than the apricots here.

Bottle sampled at Muckfest III. Clear-ish orange pour with a thin white head. Zesty and peppery nose with funk and apricot notes. Stone fruit flavor with sourness and pepperiness before a super sour lemon juice finish. Unmistakably Cantillon, and with one of the driest finishes Ive had in a sour.

UPDATED: NOV 22, 2014 750 at Mikkeller with OleR
Color is straw with amber tint, lacy white head.  Aromas of barnyard, citrus.  Incredibly sour, hints of apricot.  The acidity is clean and fruity.  A bit undercarbed with good consistency.  The apricot flavor strengthened as it warmed.  This beer was too sour for my taste when 7 years old, would really like to try it fresh.

2014 bottle rerate.  Lemony tartness with some appricot in the finish.  Much better fresh.

750ml bottles of a 05 and a 09. I am reviewing them both, but Im scoring the 05. 

Both vintages pour a hazy pale yellow color. Both have a thin off white head with some spotty lacing.

The 05 is very sour smelling. Lemon and funk are present. The 09 is very less sour smelling. The apricot is detectable in the 09 but not even a hint is present in the 05. The 05 has a bit of vinegar in the nose.

 As I was expecting, the 05 was extremely sour (one of the sourest I have ever had) with some barn yard funk and lemon. Very acidic and outright sour! Perfect for me. The more sour, the better. 
The 09 is much more tame. The apricot is noticeable here. Still tart, but not even a fraction as sour as the 05. Still a little funky but not nearly as funky as the 05.

Both were medium bodied. Nicely carbonated. Both had a tart finish, the 05 was just 10x as tart.
Pours hazy orange with a medium head. Aroma is sour malts and lots of apricot. Flavor is sour malts and apricot. Sublime. One of the best lambics Ive tried.

On draft at Churchkey in D.C. Served side by side with St.-Gilloise. Also, many bottles consumed over the past several years. A family favorite...

A: Fou Foune is a hazy yellow color. There is 1/4 inch head that fades pretty rapidly, leaving no lace.

S: The aroma is incredible, with scents of a farm, barnyard, apricots, straw.

T: The beer tastes phenomenal. Its extremely tart. Extremely tart, I said. The flavor is bold and aggressive, with apricots and sour funk causing my cheeks to pucker in delight.

M: Upon completion of my second glass, I was really feeling the finish. I felt akin to a boxer that got hit with a lot of body shots over the course of a bout. The acetic finish grows stronger with every ounce. I...cant...stop...

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Bottle at Mikkeller Bar. 2005 vintage. Hazy, light amber liquid with small to medium white head. Aroma of lemons, sour apples, popcorn, coconut (wtf?), sweat, barnyard and some very light apricots. Taste id dry and highly sour. Notes of apples and funk. Medium bodied with light carbonation. Not enough fruit left for my taste. Really looking forward to trying a younger one. Too sour as well. 6/3/7/3/17 -> 3.6
Re-rating 2015-01-28. Hazy golden liquid with medium white head. Aroma of apricots, lemon, apple skin, light funk and light almonds. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of apricots, light almonds and apple skin. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really good, a lot better than last time. Drink fresh!

Bouteille de 750ml bue et partagée avec Slovaksniper. Apothéose dabricot et de pêche dans mon verre. Cest la décadence. Les arômes et les saveurs dabricot sont bien intégrés. Le liquide coule de lui même et rafraichit durant son passage. Il est dur de résister à ce divin nectar. Jen perd mon latin. 9/10

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2013 Six drafts at alewife wIth Andy and pearl. Pours a bright hazy orange body with no head, thin white lacing. Aroma is fresh apricots, absolutely perfected. Mouthfeel is slightly dry and puckering with notes of tart apricot, sweet peach, funk and a light acidity. Great.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2014 On tap at Monks for Cantillon event with Jean Van Roy. Thanks to Jodie for getting me a glass of this from the back bar. Pours hazy and golden shimmering orange. Nice medium white head with the tiniest of bubbles, aromas of strong apricots, wet wood, ultra funky but floral. Taste is filled with apricot, peach cobbler, oak, lactic funk, sour lemons, cider apples. Its sour up front but finishes on the smoother/slightly watery side. Very pleasent aftertaste. Tried a couple 07 and 09 bottles, much more appealing with the added classic sourness from Canty. Tasty

Une Cantillon du  tonnerre bue chez mon ami Yan en pleine canicule.  Une robe orangée et troublée.  Un nez qui porte la signature de la maison et qui annonce de beaux arômes fruités dabricots et de pêches.  Un parfum plus que frais, en équilibre sur des notes acidulées et douces.  Des saveurs qui relèvent du sublime, enfin presque.  Des fruits qui ne sont jamais trop sucrés et qui ne sont jamais trop tranchants.  Des abricots et une touche citronnée qui font le bonheur de mes papilles.  Et par-dessus tout, le fameux fond de lambic Cantillon : une rencontre toujours appropriée et surtout délectable.  Une bouche qui pourrait faire école.  Un apport de bulles qui me semble juste à point.  Une texture presque huileuse.  Une finale acidulée, fruitée et asséchante.  Une excellente dégustation.  Vivement dautres bouteilles de ce nectar ensoleillé.

Awesome as usual for Cantillon.  In this variation we have the usual great balance, tart, light citrus, funk, and of course apricot in the aroma and in the 2nd half.  I love the way cantillon beers evolve in the mouth and reveal more and more the "featured ingredient" as it develops and finishes.
Bottle to oversized snifter (2011 vintage). Looks good; orange with thin lacing. Smells good too; tart and fruity. Tastes great; just like it smells with nice complexity. This is fantastic!

0.75 l bottle at Harrys, Jyväskylä. Hazy yellow orange color. The aroma and flavor are firmly acidic with grapefruit, lemon, grapefruit pith and sulfur on top. Apricot is in the background and comes through better in the finish. Excellent summer drink, quite typical for Cantillon.
2011 bottle.... It pours a hazy golden with a small white head.... The aroma is   herbs and apricot..... The flavor is sour, apricot, tart lemon and citrus....

2005 (!) bottle @ Mikkeller Bar. Deep apricot color with a tiny white head. The nose is super funky acidic, sharp cheese, massively sour and yeasty. Light paint thinner (in a good way). The taste is super-tart citrus fruits. So cheesy and funky - theres a real attitude to this beer. Loads of tart lemon peel and funky orchard fruits. The bodys light and soft. Despite the aggressive profile, this beers really quite drinkable and lovely. Overall really nice, its blunt and acerbic, but totally enjoyable.

In bottle at the 21st Weekend of Spontaneous Fermentation. Pours a light golden colour with a decent white head. Aroma of apricot, lemon and oak. Similar flavours and nicely tart with a dry finish. Moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Great!

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2014 
Draught @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. Rated on 03.01.2011
Aroma is rather sour with some earthy notes and hints of apricot. Flavour is very sour in a nice way with earthy notes. Some apricot can be observed behind those. The bottle version (2007) was less sour and much more rich on fruity apricot. I enjoy the sour draught version more but your mileage may vary.
8+4+9+4+15=4.0

Draught @ Pikkulintu
Nice and sweet aroma with lots of apricot and Cantillon house flavour and grapefruit. Flavour has nice sourness with grapefruit, some apricot and earthy tones. Apricot dominates in aroma but sour grapefruit is the king in flavour side. Still very good.
8+3+8+4+16=3.9

2005 bottle at Mikkeller bar. It pours cloudy light orange, with a thick white head. The nose is farmyard, intense lemony tartness, tart orange fruit (particularly apricot), touch of sulphur, almond and vanilla. The taste tart lemon, super-sour apricot, orange, peach, lactic acid and oak with an intense, long tart finish. Massively mouth-puckering. Medium body and fine, prickly carbonation. Wow the tartness almost ripped my face-off, but I liked it! Perhaps not the most complex Cantillon, but delicious nonetheless.

pours dark orange with a nice foamy head, micro CO2. Sour apricots on the nose. Drinks with intense and aggressive 10/10 sourness, 7/10-level tartness, barnyard funk, some puke sourness (for real), apricot jam in the background, mild bitterness in the end. Cant say Im a fan of this one - too sour, too funk, not enough sweetness / fruity flavour to enjoy.

UPDATED: DEC 1, 2012 Shared from two different bottles. Poured a hazy golden yellow color with a foamy, fuzzy white head. Aroma was apricots, fruit notes, tartness. Flavor was tart, with notes of mouth puckering tartness. This one was actually quite good. Very happy for those two people who brought this on over. Very refreshing.

Poured on draft @ Novare Res and orange yellow color with a gaseous head that dissipated very quickly.  Aromas of sour fruit; peaches, apricot and a hint of wet hay funkiness. On the palate it punches right off with rich fruit flavors of apricot, peach and then rides the high carbonation bubbly flavors into a dry lingering sour finish.  Amazingly refreshing and complex !
